text: I have been to Chestnut many times and it gets better and better!  Lots of gluten free options (all the salads are GF) and everything I've tried is delicious.  I adore the banana bread pancakes -- they are fantastic.  The winter quinoa salad is beyond wonderful -- I dream about it.  The coffee is incredible -- be sure to try the lavender honey latte.  Heaven!  Such a fun hangout -- love the atmosphere and the outdoor patio.  Chestnut has become a quick favorite -- can't get enough of it!

I'm not sure if this is the same as the old chestnut lane across the street or not but the old one had these awesome chocolate chip cookies and they are trying to make the same one and I have had them twice and they are not the same, sad for me.  I will still probably try them again though as I dream of the old ones sometime when i am craving some cookie action.    Went in here a few times just seems a little strange, did look over to the right and noticed food all over the floor in the kitchen which seemed strange for such a place.  Saw a tasty looking loaf of coffee cake on the counter with no price marked, lady at the counter said embarrassingly, 32.00 dollars, and I put the cake back on the counter.  Never heard of such a thing.  We also got some muffins that seems like they needed help like the cookies.

I love this place! It is truly my home away from home. The bimbop bowl is amazing, chicken salad sandwich is a favorite ( and I normally hate chicken salad) and the blt is amazing too! The cookies are to die for and my kids make me stop every time we drive by. I've used them for catering many times and I'm always impressed. Chestnut is an incredible addition to Phoenix and I'm so happy they are here.
Great little place!! So far no complaints, I like the atmosphere.  Servers were nice and the food was great. Looking forward to  the next visit.

The parking lot is a little confusing but we managed to make it in. Cute decor and space, very relaxing. Reasonable prices for local health food fair. You order at the counter and food is brought to your table. Enjoyed our breakfast, the portions are just a little small. We had the granola bowl, lemon ricotta waffles and egg scramble plate. Only complaint was the menu board had less items than the printed menu and they didn't point that our ahead of time. The printed menu has some delicious sounding items we would have ordered instead! Now we have to go back ;) but that's ok with me!

Literally one star and that's for creating enough curiosity when driving by to actually stop in.   We tried this place today for lunch and there were red flags everywhere. The menu is nothing special. The hardest part was deciding which mediocre choice sounded like the best. My husband chose a turkey jalapeno carrot slaw sandwich. He said it was so hot from the fresh jalapenos that a rare few would be able to eat it. I had a prosciutto brie frischece or something. Nothing exciting going on there.   We sat at a table that wobbled, thought about moving to the next but it wobbled too. The cushion was terribly dirty. There were crumbs and stains. It looked like the seat under my daughter's car seat. Gross.   I am not just picking on this place. I've never even felt compelled to write a review before today. This place was a waste of money and we left hungry. I expect more for the area. If the only thing going for this place is their oatmeal..sad day for the owners. This place really needs a better menu for choosing such a bold color to represent their establishment. We were drawn to it because of the color, but we should have read the reviews first.

The s'more galore is awesome ( best thing ever) . The l'lumberjack is very healthy and sweet ( I would recommend getting the waffles) . For adults I would get kale bowl or the fruit granola thing. The seating outside is very clean and nice. Chestnut has very good service . Nice and clean inside. Very cute little accessories and little cute kits.

Second time here. This place lost a star because they implemented valet parking. [prepare for small rant] Valet parking for this size of restaurant is the dumbest thing they could have done. I understand the girls who own this place want to pretend this place is nicer than it is, but it's not valet parking nice. There are literally 8 parking spots! The dirty chai is really good  and the oatmeal is one of the best I've had. The bacon is candied, I personally am not a fan of that.

Unfortunately we were disappointed in Chestnut. We gave them time to work out the kinks of a new spot but no such luck. The food is below mediocre and had no flavor! The waffles were like eating flour and water. They bring each dish out individually which makes it awkward unless you are eating alone. Numerous tables were complaining about the length of time it took to get items (30 minutes for flavorless waffles for us), the taste of the food, and the lack of silverware.  When the table next to us told the manager her response was " I  trying!" What?!?!  Don't waste your time here unless you are going for a coffee and pastry (made outside by Tammy Coe and delightful).  Go to Carmels across the street or LGO instead.

Bottom line: the food is average for the vibe/price point they're going for here. You're better off going to LGO for a better tasting option in the same genre.  I ordered an egg/bacon sandwich which was fine, but average. My girlfriend's salad had old avocado and was generally bland and unexciting. The chicken in the salad was particularly dry and unappetizing.  You can't spend more money on decorating and establishing the look of your restaurant's brand than you do on the food.

A friend of mine took me in for lunch for the first time. The atmosphere is very cute, open and bright, not was what I was expecting from the outside view. Staff was friendly and helpful as soon as we walked in. I ordered the Chestnut Chopped Salad and loved it. The chicken was a little dry but overall a lot of flavor. Look forward to going again!

Constantly disappointed.  My kid loves it here because of the gluten free pancakes, and he's gluten intolerant. So we come back because he insists. But every time some thing goes wrong. One time I asked for oatmeal, and I get granola. Cold eggs, another & burnt coffee one time before that.    This time the I asked for gluten free toast on the side. After I put jam & take a bite I realize it's cold hard bread & not toasted. I tell the waitress I wanted a side of toast. She apologizes & returns 5 minutes later with the same slice I originally had now toasted dark brown ... including the original bitten piece with the jam now cooked into it. Seriously?!? That's pretty cheap that you can't toast a new slice.   Also, the glazing on every slice of bacon is a little over the top. Some don't like sweet bacon but that's not option since you guys don't serve normal bacon. Same goes for the walnuts. Diabetes is a problem & myself included try to watch the sugars we eat. Every now & then we like to indulge but not all the time.   The ambience is great, some of the servers are great, others not so much. I'm not saying don't come here, I'm just saying be prepared to be disappointed.

Bummed that I didn't have a good first impression.  Ordered the Bahn? Chicken sandwich. The chicken was super dry and tasteless.  The roll is a plain white sub roll. Not even a good one. May give it another shot. The salads looked good. It is pricey too.

Loved this place. so cute, great product mix from local artisans, the food and drinks were really great. I had a mimosa and the morning bibimbap bowl. my friend had the mule and the egg salad sandwich- both really good as well. They had free wifi so I was able to get some work done as well.

This place has so much potential but the wrong people (hire people who smile and have s sense of urgency)! The ordering process is slow and customers are dissatisfied with service. With a $6 latte - focus on the experience

Good food! I usually go in for the prosciutto breakfast sandi and some granola.   Great food, they just need to nail down the consistency with the food... That will come with time!  Coffee is good, just wish they had a well trained barista/coffee lover. That really makes the coffee, especially with the creative designs, I love those!  Overall great breakfast spot!

I had a wonderful breakfast of Lemon Ricotta Waffles and a side of bacon. Seriously delicious. Even with the bigger cup of coffee, my meal was only $15 after tip. I found the service to be very friendly. The guy at the counter gave me lots of info and recommendations when I told him I was a first-timer. Beautiful, airy, sunny atmosphere with great food. I'll be back.

I was so excited to see this open as I was a regular at Chestnut Lane and I live in the neighborhood, so today I decided to visit. First of all, not same owner. So I stayed and ordered a $9.00 egg salad sandwich.........bread a little hard. But the kicker was the $6.00 "Lavender Honey" coffee. I take responsibility of not knowing how much drink was as I looked at the menu board and not the actual menu. When I questioned the cost ..I was told well it is served in a large cup. Yes it is, and I got maybe 6oz watery coffee with pretty foam . If you are going to charge $6.00 for a coffee/latte whatever  don't serve it in a 20 oz cup. And I do know it is a 20 oz. cup. I went home with my big cup/tiny drink and brewed a cup with my Keurig..........still tasted watery.  I was told 2 different stories about the drink. The owner (I think) offered to refund me my money. I did not take it. I won't be back.  You don't need my money or business.....

We enjoyed eating breakfast on the patio at Chestnut in late November.  I had the Sandi with bacon. It was absolutely delicious. A little heavy on the aioli but I was ok with it. Every element of the sandwich was fresh and satisfying.  My friend had the lemon ricotta waffles and loved them. I tasted a bite and the lemon ricotta was velvety and tart.  The service at the counter wasn't super friendly but it was prompt and courteous. We met the owner on our way out, she was very friendly and chatted with us for a few minutes.  I would recommend Chestnut if you're in search of something fresh and different for breakfast.

I love Chestnut.  The chicken salad is pure white meat and not smothered in mayo or added fillers...just pure quality chicken.  The green goddess salad is amazing.  I ordered it with the noodles heated.  The baked oatmeal is delicious-a daily must have.  The pastries are baked fresh.  My favorites are the chocolate chip cookies and maple oat scones.  Well worth the calories!  I love the atmosphere and the fact you can order at the counter and not have to wait for a server to take your order.  The staff is friendly and willing to please.  Chestnut is an added bonus to the Arcadia area.

Great food and great service. The baked oatmeal is amazing, has great flavors and is not something I couldn't find anywhere else. The waffles are great too.   My only complaint is that they used to squeeze their juice fresh (the Bruce lee is my go to, I stop by at least once a week to pick up) but they have changed it and have the juice pre-squeezed. The best time to drink juice is within 10 minutes, so it loses a lot of the value I am looking for. Won't be stoping by anymore for juice but I'll for sure be back from time to time for food.   They used to have great fresh baked goods (yummy banana chips) but they've added Tammy Coe which is a bummer because I can buy that anywhere these days.   Overall, great food, great atmosphere, and great service, I tell all my friends to try it!

Unique and interesting menu, all freshly made.  The salads are fantastic.  Very open and airy with patio seating on Camelback Road.  Cartel coffee and freshly made juices are a great addition to the breakfast menu.  The staff told us a Happy Hour is coming soon.  Great location.

45 minutes later and we are still waiting for two to go salads. We know it will be even longer because the man who ordered before us, is still waiting.  The staff seems oblivious to how long people are waiting for their food. Since we have been waiting, no one has bussed dirty tables. Having run into this situation before we decided to give it one more try. Ugh!

This is the first Yelp review I've written and I'm compelled to tell you how delicious Water Chestnut is! Full disclosure,  I've been to Chestnut before. It's been a while as I felt it was overpriced for a breakfast/lunch place, but this was before they began the Ramen dinner concept. I can't speak to the ambiance. I had my dinner delivered by Uber Eats. The food on the other hand, surpassed my expectations. I had the flash fried beef pot stickers, short rib bao steamed buns, egg rolls with plum sauce and mango sticky rice. The pot stickers (3 to an order) were cooked perfectly and the sauce was flavorful with the just the right saltiness. The short rib bao steamed buns (3 to an order)... Yum! The buns were light and fluffy. The beef was seasoned and cooked well. The egg rolls (also 3 to an order) were very tasty and the plum sauce was clearly made in-house. Not too sweet but very flavorful. Lastly, the mango sticky rice. Light and delicious! Total was around $30 for all of the above, although Uber adds a small percentage. Will definitely order from here again!

Like every restaurant, you have to find what you like. The pancakes breakfast is great! They have a fantastic desert menu!!! Mouth watering!  Unique menu, small portions, healthy, and friendly is the best way to describe this place.

Excited about a new breakfast place and had to try.  Very disappointed!  I had the "Sandi"  -  the eggs were cold and it was extremely dry with no flavor.  Ordered the carrot muffin too (which was never brought to our table - we had to chase it down)  which was stale and tasted like cardboard.  We were not given water which I would think would be a given.   Overall not good and I won't be going back....too bad!

I am pretty sure there is a saying about the definition of stupidity is doing things again and again and expecting a different outcome. I have been here before, several months apart, and had poor service and mediocre food but it is SO CLOSE to my house. I really want to like it. However, today was the last straw: an uncooked chocolate croissant. When I picked it up I was surprised at how heavy and dense it felt. After biting, the cause was revealed to be raw dough. I can't even bring myself to return it because the dude at the counter had such a bad attitude and that was just when I was ordering. Ok so I learned my lesson, I won't be back.

As soon as I walked up, my eyes got a delightful feast from all the designer decor, delicious pastries, and cute cashiers.   However, after I got inside it was kind of hard to navigate and figure out exactly where to order, some signage is much needed.   This place is just starting out, and it's apparent. The employees didn't seem to know the menu very well or how to navigate the POS systems. We ordered breakfast and elixers. It would have been nice if we got our drinks before we sat down, but we had to ask the food runner to locate them. Also, no water when we sat down either, a must here in Arizona.   Now on to the food: It came out quickly and it looked fantastic. We were able to set the other things aside because the food was so damn good.   I had a breakfast bowl with quinoa, poached eggs, kale, and chili sauce. I've been on this crazy organic, vegan, no sugar, wanna kill myself because I just want a donut diet, but this is one of the few places in the valley that has fresh, healthy dishes.   My boyfriend had the banana bread pancakes with bacon. OH MY LORD. I just had a bite, but it was the most magical experience I've had all week.   Once Chestnut works out all the kinks, I think it's going to be one of the hottest breakfast/lunch spots.   Has a hip vibe and fantastic food. I highly recommend.

I went there this morning and it was a big mistake not to order from the menu!  I'm not into a lot of sweets and the oatmeal is just like the Olive and Ivy's, so thought I'd try something simple like 1 scrambled egg and toast.  You'd think there would be a nice plate with a fluffy scrambled egg and crispy toast, no , just two poor plates:one  with 2 so so eggs and one with a piece of warm bread.  the waiter did ask if I wanted something on the "bread" and I asked for butter, he delivered practically frozen butter. coffee was strong almost bitter.  yes, parking is difficult depending on what way you are coming in.  ambiance is nice, otherwise there are many other options in the area. and I'm surprised after the big build up in the Arcadia News that the owner isn't answering any of the yelp comments.  I should know better: you have to order the specialties, they can't do simple.

Great location and good atmosphere, but over priced and the food is nothing special at all. The salads looked ok, but the sandwiches are boring - I even had to asked for some kind of dressing for my turkey sandwich after they brought it out dry. I would've rather made lunch at home.
Overpriced and pretentious as well as extremely difficult to access from either 44th St or Camelback. So many better choices than this. Not worth the trouble.

We went here for the first time today and it was terrible. The restaurant was not super busy, but we waited well over 30 minutes for our food (for two people). When our meals finally arrived, they were both cold and had clearly been sitting out for a while; cold, hard scrambled eggs and salmon that was so cold, it had to have come straight from the refrigerator. Minimal service from staff-you order at the counter and they bring your food out to you. Definitely not worth the $30 spent; will never return here and would not recommend it to anyone.
Chestnut is the perfect place for a brunch girls day and provides a great environment to enjoy company!

What a disappointment! We were so excited to visit this place for the first time, but the food was served cold and everything was tasteless. It took forever to get our order even though the place was not too busy. Pancakes where blend and bacon was very greasy and not crispy. We for sure know that we are not coming back to this place.

Great food and nice mgt but filthy - tables were not cleared or wiped clean, floors were dirty with globs of food and puddles, entrance looked like it had never been swept. This is an easy problem to solve. Someone should do it because it has good food and location.
Great atmosphere with the Arcadia Phx touch! I love the walk up counter idea and most food options are healthy and tasty!

Always wanted to visit when I drove by and finally made the time today. I had the hipped salad and it was one of my favorite salads I've ever had! Definitely a fun spot I will return to again and again.

Stopped in for breakfast on Saturday morning. There were only people at one or two tables when we arrived but all other tables in the restaurant had dirty dishes on them. We were going to leave but someone came over and said they would clean a table for us. To me, this is a bad sign when I walk in and dirty dishes are left all over. You get in line and order your own meal, take a number and sit down. I ordered my yogurt, fruit and homemade granola with no strawberries due to an allergy and it came out with strawberries all over it. They took it back to remake it. It was good in the end. The ricotta waffle was cut into four pieces. Two tasted ok, and two didn't. Not sure why there wasn't consistency. I would say the food was ok, but nothing I would make a special trip for. If I was in the area I would possibly go again, but not sure about that.

My best friend and I had brunch at Chestnut yesterday. We automatically fell in love with the open space and ambience. It definitely  has an east coast feel to it. I had the breakfast bowl with quinoa, poached eggs, kale, and chili sauce ... it was delicious and had a nice spicy kick to it! My friend had the waffles, which looked amazing and yup they tasted amazing as well! I am not big on coffee but they serve Cartel coffee and teas. Their menu looks like a nice change from your typical breakfast/lunch spots. The staff was very friendly and helpful. As many of you mentioned, this is a new place ... I would suggest for you to grab a menu as soon as you walk in (next to cashier) as that will make it less confusing. I have high hopes for Chestnut and will definitely visit again soon!

I hear the breakfast is wonderful, but we went for ramen and the entire experience was a huge let down. Service was horrible, spicy edemame was horrible ( but the garlic edemame was good). We had to ask for plates, ask for silverware and our daughter had to go find napkins.  Saw our waitress maybe three time the entire meal, the last when she charged us for food we didn't order.  The ramen was decent, but not to drive for. And the chairs were from a medieval torture chamber!  My back still hurts :(  Go for breakfast, but skip dinner.
Went back for the banana bread pancakes. They taste like a blend of oatmeal and cardboard.

We visited Chestnut for the first time today, ordering the lobster roll and lobster Cobb salad.  Our food arrived with a strong fishy odor, the patrons at the next table actually cringed.  The lobster was stringy and clearly rotten.  We sent the food back and the manager came over to apologize.  I asked her if she tasted the lobster and she said no, she doesn't eat lobster.  She explained that the lobster is frozen, not fresh, because we aren't near an ocean.  Huh????  The manager offered to order us something else and refund the difference.  She also provided a gift card.  She handled it well.  I suggested to her that the chef should be checking the lobster before it is served as it has clearly been thawed and unused for days.  For $16 a plate I would have expected fresh lobster, the live version that is flown all over the country, something they seem not to know.  I will not return unless they upgrade their chefs.  They seem not to care that food is clearly rotten before serving it to customers.

We just stopped by for a cup of coffee. To my disappointment two cups if coffee were 8.19. I thought that might be a decent price for a pour over but the girl walked over to a thermos and poured our coffee. It's disappointing to pay four dollars for a cup of coffee that you don't know when it was made.   The place is cute but I can't see it topping LGO, it doesn't make sense to pay those prices when there are so many other great options close within reach.   I gave two stars because the service was friendly.

So this place is great. Great location, nice clean decor, no waiter service (which is ok I guess). So far my favorite items off the menu are the Lemon Ricotta Waffles and the Winter Grain Salad. I would say stay away from the pancakes (a little too healthy for me, so flavor was lacking). I tried the Bahn Mi which was ok. My friend had the egg salad sandwhich which I tasted and it was pretty good for egg salad (not my favorite thing), it wasn't too heavy on the mayo or the mustard.

Great atmosphere and even better food!   I love that I can bring my kiddos and they have a space to be creative while I have lunch with friends.  It's everything I could want in a neighborhood family-friendly restaurant!  The food is health conscious and tasty and I love that they've paired with Cartel coffee--it's truly a one stop shop!
Finally got to visit and was not impressed. Way over priced and the service was not great. Such a shame, great location and cute decor.

The Arcadia neighborhood needed some new brunch spots, and Chestnut has claimed a prominent spot in my brunch & coffee neighborhood rotation (disclaimer: I am not a fan of The Henry due to dismal service and lackluster food). It is also a great place for casual working breakfasts/lunches with colleagues.   Fantastic coffee (coffee beans supplied by Cartel, which is rare to find in this area), with the Honey Lavender Latte rating as my favorite coffee beverage in the neighborhood these days. Manny, the primary barista, is very friendly and talkative - and makes delicious coffees. The juices are also great, I have been ordering the Bruce Lee (with Cayenne pepper) a lot recently to help fend off the cold and flu that has been circulating in the Valley.   The food is delicious, with interesting new renditions of old classics and fantastic innovations, adding a spicy asian twist to some dishes. The names of the dishes are also very fun. I usually order brunch regardless of the time of day -- the waffles and pancakes are both terrific, and the Sandi with Bacon is always a go to item for a savory brunch craving. And if you see the strawberry muffins, definitely try one. They don't appear daily and they are delicious. For lunch, the lobster roll is fantastic.   Two sisters own the place and are frequently seen walking around, saying hi to their customers. They are very nice and always greet me and my friends that I bring here. They did a fantastic job with the design, the place is very bright and airy with warm colors and inviting decor. It is a great place to have a few coffees and work at the bar for a few hours.   Regarding some of the negative comments -- are there issues that can yield problematic dining experiences? Yes there can be. It is still a new place working out the kinks and service sometimes suffers as a result. While it has never happened to me personally, I have seen it happen to other diners around me. However in my experience the staff always works to rectify errors if you explain the problem and give them the chance.   They will be opening happy hour in the next few weeks and I look forward to seeing their wine list and drink concoctions when they debut!

You can get breakfast and lunch here, treats from Tammie Coe, flowers from Camelback Flowershop and coffee from Cartel.  I myself, like to start with a dirty Chai and then head straight into lunch with a hearty Five Spice Banh Mi.  A gorgeous piece of bread topped with chicken, carrots, daikon, cucumbers, pickled onions, jalapenos, cilantro and a sriracha lime mayo.  It comes with a side of sweet potato chips, they are good!  Looking for breakfast?  The banana bread pancakes might peak your interest, they're gluten free so beware of the different texture but they come with vermont maple syrup, honeyed walnuts and some bacon.    If you're in the mood for a different kind of take on breakfast try the Morning Bibimbap bow.  It's filled with quinoa, tamari, green onions and sauteed kale with poached eggs and korean chili paste.  This is going to fill up your belly and put a little fire in your mouth.  Also check out the green eggs and ham, true to its name, the eggs look green because of the fresh pesto they place on top, prosciutto and arugula help round this beauty out.

My wife and I had lunch at Chestnut restaurant at 44th st and Camelback yesterday. It was a terrible experience. The staff in the back was very loud joking around and laughing. They were stacking chairs and moving empty tables to prepare for end of day cleanup. (They close at 2pm in the summer). The manager was oblivious to what was going on. The food was not much better than the staff!! Go somewhere else!!!!

So nice to have a restaurant in Arcadia that is bright, beautifully designed and different! The food is fresh, interesting... and healthy. As a vegetarian they offer many choices, including the 5 Spice Banh Mi, which is one of the best sandwiches I have eaten in any city (it is actually spicey!). After living in NY, LA, SF and Miami this place has the feel of a great neighborhood restaurant in one of those cities. The owners are almost always there and the staff is very friendly. Any kinks from just opening have been addressed quickly (lots of new signage, etc) and they really listen to their clients. Great kids menu, too!
Great restaurant! Beautiful space. Great management and staff. A must go to place. Cute flower shop inside.

I walked out this morning  This place is a counter service when you order and they bring you your food/drink. My wife and I stood first in-line and waited for someone to approach the POS terminal.A guy walked up and instructed us to move out of the way as he was helping someone else.  We shifted to the left a few steps and kept looking at the menu. He finished with the lady and proceeded to help the next in-line. At this time there were about 5 people in line and we were instructed to go to the back of the line. I will never return, and it's a shame as I live right around the corner. I will be telling this story to many people.  The Henry is caddy corner to this place, is cheaper and far nicer. oh and it has  professional service.  Alan

Saw the not so great reviews so I stayed away with so many other great choices nearby. That was a MISTAKE. Not sure what they've done of late but everything I've ordered is great starting with the house made pastries to the egg breakfast. The staff is so helpful and nice. The atmosphere is darling and I go at least once a week!!
Don't order the turkey or chicken pesto sandwich. The meat was so salty I couldn't eat it.  The cheese grilled sandwich is delicious.  Next time I will stay with that!

This little gem of a restaurant with its view of Camelback Mountain was the perfect setting for my daughters bridal shower. Kirsten worked with us developing a delicious  menu and even accommodated a couple of vegans in the group of thirty. The food was great. Service was excellent. Loved the vegan hash and pastries. The whole Chestnut team is awesome. We will be back soon.

Chestnut is where I take out-of-towners for a casual Sunday brunch (but having worked across the street, I know it's good anytime!).  Upscale enough to show that I care and have good taste, but casual enough to avoid pretension.  The food is clever, diverse, and consistently excellent.  The bloody mary excels through simplicity.  The coffee is both thoughtfully chosen and well brewed.  Ordering is done at the cash register, and comes with friendly service.  The flower shop is an interesting store-within-a-store and a feast for the eyes.  If you have the occasion to speak to the owner (or one of the owners, perhaps?), consider yourself lucky.  She was effortlessly classy and nice.

had breakfast here last weekend and I liked it very much.  Coffee was very good (Cartel), food was creative, FAST delivery and hot.  poached eggs with prosciutto, fresh arugula and pesto drizzle - YUM.  Brian, the chef came out to ask us what we thought and spent a lot of time chatting with us.  I hope for a long, bright and successful future for this restaurant!

I was shocked when I saw this place only had 3 stars. It couldn't be any cuter-- a perfect environment to take friends to brunch. I've enjoyed everything I've had here. The highlights have been the Bruce Lee-- don't be deterred by the spicy ingredients, you'll love it-- and the Green Goddess salad with the delicious noodles underneath. Service is fast and efficient-- walk-ups are my favorite, no waiting for a server.   There's a camelback flower shop inside and it's fun to enjoy their little arrangements on your table.   I'm a sucker for cute delicious places, especially in the Arcadia area, and I absolutely recommend coming here!

I really wanted to like this place since it's so cute and convenient, but it was a total flop. We went there for Sunday brunch and they were out of champagne, grapefruit juice, and green juice. I ordered the salmon kale toast, and the "smoked salmon" was literally a can of grey salmon dumped on top of the toast. It was still in the shape of the can! My friend's pancake was raw in the middle. A sign fell off the wall and hit my other friend in the head and they only offered her half off her next beverage. We explained some of our issues to the food runners, and they couldn't care less. There are way too many great brunch places in Scottsdale/Phoenix to ever go back here.

Unfortunate experience overall...  -Waited about 10 minutes for service. One man who wasn't our server brought us waters, said our waitress would be right over, and no one asked us if we had been helped otherwise, or even looked at us. Maybe 5 tables in the entire building.   -No apologies from our awkward waitress. Jumped right into the ordering. Seemed to know nothing about the menu. When I ordered a Beer by its name, she seemed confused. So I had to verbalize "IPA" and clarify what I asked for. It doesn't help for her that the traffic is so loud at night. Didn't seem to know a single thing about the food either.  (Small menu... management isn't doing their part to make sure the staff knows the simplest things.)  -Late food. On the apps, there are flash fried beef pot stickers and steamed veggie stickers. When I asked for "one order of each, the veggie and the beef potstickers" I must have confused her. Had to explain that too, three or four times, and when they arrived, they were both steamed. Both disappointing in quality, and came AFTER our dinner.   - Food quality of the ramen, soba, AND egg noodles... I hate sounding rude but my top ramen creations at home are way better and a little cheaper.   - A kind but also strange interaction with a cook after everything was finished. I really appreciate her trying to improve the experience and get feedback, but she was also not helping the cause after a few minutes. Good for her for trying, though! Just wanted to leave at this point and had to ask for the check a couple of times.   -Desert was poor, but that's just personal taste. Green tea ice cream and a little sesame friend ball thingy. Waitress didn't know what it was either lol.  -Little things. Bus tub set on our table, gross. Paid $1 or $2 for cabbage and got a single small leaf?! And all the condiments still had original lids that you had to peel off. Nice that they're new, not nice having to unscrew and recap everything.

My 2nd time eating here- fun and bright with great food and service.  As a vegetarian I have tons of options and brought a "glutton free" friend who also had no trouble finding something to eat.  They serve Cartel coffee which is amazing!
Second time I have been there.  Takes forever to order.  Then it takes even longer to get your food!  45 minutes for a waffle!  They say grab and go.   Not so much Probably won't go back

This a cute brunch spot where you order and pay first, find a seat, and they bring the food to you. We tried a few different dishes: the lemon ricotta waffles, banana bread pancakes, the blueberry pop tart, and the morning bibimbop. The waffles were the best of the bunch followed by the pancakes. The blueberry pop tart was out of this world good. Our least favorite was the bibimbop since it had way too much kale and not enough quinoa for the price. The cold brew was a bit light for my taste but then again I really do love strong coffee. I'll definitely come back and try some of their other brunch menu items.

Today was the official opening of Chestnut. I meet some friends for lunch. When you walk into the big open space, you order at the counter, receive a number and find a table. Our drinks (green tea) were delivered promptly.  I ordered the Green Goddess salad that had rice noodles, kale, swiss chard, cashews, toasted coconut and a spicy Asian dressing. It only took about 5-10 min to receive our food and the service was always with a smile. The salad was very good...maybe better if they would have had more greens and less noodles, but still light and delicious. My friends ordered the Chestnut Chop salad which looked good and the Lobster Roll, which looked AMAZING. This is not the mayo-loaded-gut-bomb you have come to expect from lobster rolls. I didn't even see any mayo. I can't tell you about the taste because my friend refused to give up one bite and finished the whole thing! lol  The patio is great. There is an adorable flower shop inside as well.   Welcome to the neighborhood Chestnut, you will be seeing a lot of me!

My sandwich takeout order was completed by a nail polish wearing male cashier at 11:53.  Food arrived at 12:34.  And yes, I did double check by asking them for it after I had been waiting.  Absolutely unacceptable!  No wonder they had so many empty tables during the lunch rush.  The food itself was okay but I had to wolf it down rapidly on my drive back to work, so I didn't really get to savor it.  It was also somewhat difficult to figure out where I was "allowed" to park.

2.5 stars.  I was excited to try Chestnut because it looked so cute!!!  We had a muffin and an 8 dollar bowl of pineapple and a few strawberries:(. It was not good:(. Muffin just average and to top it off the guy taking orders at the counter was super cranky!! We won't be back! I'd much rather go to Le Grande Orange!!!   Kristen, yes all that you mentioned was missing from the fruit salad!  It was literally a bowl of 8 dollar pineapple. You can PM me if needed.

I always get the green eggs and ham. Today I tried the ricotta waffles. They were very yummy. Would recommend both. Also love the juices. Hubby loved the sweet potato chips. The toys for the kids helped have a smooth trip, and the staff is always helpful and friendly.

Did nothing for us. Very limited healthy but expensive menu. The chicken salad sandwich was very average but the sweet potato chips and ice tea were good. The lobster cob salad was just average as well.

I love love love this place!!! You walk in and it's so clean and bright and inviting. You order up front and sit wherever.  The food is delicious and the staff are really what I miss the most about Phoenix.  Nice people. This is my new favorite place. Goodbye Henry.

Worst breakfast/brunch experience. I ordered the smoked salmon toast and the whole meal looked disgusting. They don't know how to make a plate look nice and appetizing. The kale was everywhere I couldn't even see my toast and the salmon was salty from a can.  My boyfriend ordered The Jam and his side potatoes were stale and super salty.  Nobody came back to ask us if everything looks ok or if we need anything else. And they were not even busy.  Such a disappointing experience.  Later Edit: Thank you Kirsten for taking the time to address my complain.  I don't have a problem where the salmon is coming from I have a problem with the presentation. The food just didn't look good everything was just a pile of kale with cold fish.  And those side potatoes were not cooked on the spot. I know you don't have servers but you definitely have cooks that don't care that much.
Loved the roasted brussel sprouts with balsamic salad.  Adding the salmon made for a very good lunch!

We visited for brunch recently and enjoyed the food and atmosphere. I had the banana pancakes which were delicious. It's important to note that these are a gluten free  and healthful option and therefore are not the standard fluffy white pancakes you'll get elsewhere (although they have those too). They are more akin to a whole grain banana bread than a pancake. A couple in our order were slightly too brown on one side but the others just right. Other dishes ordered at our table were good too, with the eggs coming out cooked as requested, and the sandwiches are a good choice too, particularly the Ban Mi. Where to order is still slightly confusing, and depending on who's at the register you get a warm, friendly, smile or an apathetic stare, but that's probably the case at most casual restaurants on a Sunday morning.

Long wait to order. Confusing set up with two entrances. Out of ricotta waffles on a Saturday morning??? Ordered banana pancakes instead and was told only after we sat down and had been waiting over ten minutes that there would be a longer wait since they've ran out of pancake batter. 30 min later they brought them out! I normally would have just cancelled the order but I hadn't tried the restaurant out yet and was curious. When they appeared, there were two small pancakes. $8 for two small pancakes and some bacon. Lame. They could have apologized or say hey, pancakes are on us but it didn't appear they we're phased by keeping a customer waiting 40 minutes and not apologize?  The food over all was good but not worth the wait. Coffee isn't that great. My friend and I thought it tasted sweet and odd.

A quaint and simple breakfast/lunch place. My daughter and I ate here for lunch.  Although the menu was small, the food was good. It is what I would call clean simple food. The fruit salad was my favorite part!!! The sandwich wasn't anything special, but the sweat potato fries were yummy! Their breakfast menu looked much more enticing to me than their lunch menu.

Limited menu, confusing set up. Baked goods (muffin at least) dry and grainy. Order delivered to table in spurts. Waiter came by twice asking if we had ordered a smoothie. Finally had to go back to the counter to get the muffin we ordered. Had a sand I with bacon. Egg was cooked perfectly, bacon was well done and flavorful, English muffin was disappointing. If they make it through the first year I'll be surprised.

This used to be our "5 star" go to for an amazing breakfast. Not so much anymore :( the food when they first opened was incredible! Amazing eggs, the sweetest bacon, and fluffy pancakes (for a scramble). Now there seemed to be barely one egg, not warm when served. The bacon was nothing to write home about. Pancakes as well. Still a decent breakfast, but not as amazing as it used to be! It used to be okay to be overpriced because of the delicious food- now I would prefer to go to First Watch just down the street.  Hoping they bring back their original recipes.

Our first time here. Very nice ambiance. Relaxed atmosphere. Excellent homemade pastries. The traditional breakfast was delicious. Alas, the coffee was only average. We have added this to our favorites! We will return.

Catastrophe! When I went out to dinner tonight I did not expect to be over the toilet vomiting!  It is completely incompetent to have employees that have no clue what is in the food and tell customers false info. On their ramen menu they have listed an egg and a soy egg. I told the waiter I'm vegan and he said the soy egg was made from tofu and water. Then I try it and I call the waiter over and say OMG what is this egg made of? He said don't worry and reassures me it's made from tofu and is vegan. Then I take another bite and ask him wow how do you get the yolk like that, then the manager hears me and says it's a real egg dipped in soy sauce! I have not eaten an egg in over 8 years for many reasons and yes they comped our meal but that does not make up for in any way that they violated my beliefs. I can't imagine if someone had allergies as they are clueless. They need to fix their menu so it is clear.  So they made me another bowl and I have to say it did not have any flavor. So if you're looking for good ramen this is NOT the place for you.   Never again.

Went to Water Chestnut the other night. The ramen was pretty good. But the calamari and the mango and sticky rice was the absolute worst I've ever had! The calamari was chewy and tasted disgusting. The server obviously saw that we didn't like it. She never offered us a new appetizer or to take it off the bill. She then brought us our check without offering us dessert. We decided to order the mango and sticky rice as take out. Worst decision ever! The rice was hard and not even sticky. The mango was chalky not even ripe. Seriously, so terrible!! Go for the ramen but don't order anything else!

Disclaimer: This review is going to sound really snobby and I don't care.   This was disappointing.   Their menu looked exciting but there's also a falsely advertised "Bibimbap Breakfast Bowl" which my wife ordered. Quinoa and kale with a smear of sriracha and a poached egg is definitely not Bibimbap. It doesn't come with meat nor is it served in a stone bowl. It was also watery which was weird. The cashier seemed annoyed with the questions about the dish as we were asking what made it bibimbap, like if there wasn't any meat, stone bowl or veggies outside of kale. This guy didn't have any patience for customers. Turns out this guy is the manager. Great start Chestnut...  She also ordered a soy latte in a mug. It was served extremely hot and the milk was burned so she asked for another. We watched the guy make it with real milk and without a thermometer in the milk. How does he know if he isn't burning the milk if he isn't using a thermometer? These are standard at all Starbucks and most coffee shops. He delivered the latte and when we asked if it was soy he said he was "pretty sure" so we pointed out the gallon of milk he used and asked if that was soy. He didn't really have an answer for us and took the drink away. We got a refund from the apathetic manager/cashier.  We were served our dishes silently by the same guy that made the latte who turned around to do something else leaving me to get up to find silverware and napkins. I get that it's a "seat yourself" place but napkins and silverware should be provided.   I ordered the short rib sandwich and sweet potato chips. It was all very greasy and while I admit that I ordered the sandwich without onions and cheese, the flavor left a lot to be desired. A Korean BBQ sauce or glaze would have made it perfect. The bread was very greasy as well but it was delicious which raises my review from 1 to 2 stars. I believe they get it from Noble Bread.   Our overall takeaway was that this place doesn't care about their customers. They were annoyed with our questions about the menu. They didn't pay attention to the coffee order and come on, "pretty sure" it's soy?? That is not the answer. Know what you're serving your customer. And give your customers silverware and napkins. We felt like our presence was an inconvenience to the FOH staff and will not be returning.

Ok, let me just start out by saying that the best tuna sandwich in town is here (you get the choice of hot or cold! Who does that?!). Not to say that reason alone is the only thing you should look for here. Quite the contrary. The treats (scones, muffins, cookies, and more) are tastebud-meltingly amazing. Full choice of breakfast selections, smoothies, juices, and sandwiches-all able to satisfy the super health conscious and those in to let their cravings run wild. The coffee is also top notch and would eat Starbucks' for lunch (or breakfast.lol) given a head to head confrontation.   That would almost be enough to justify that I did my part in sharing with my fellow local Arizona restaurant fans the gift that this place is for us who live here-but it's not! Reason being, I would be forgetting to mention how friendly the staff is here and great the service is. Expect to feel welcome when you come in, and unfortunately, that is not the case in most restaurants nowadays.   Next, this place looks hip, has a very clean and modern look, which you can see from the minimalist design of the menus, to the touchscreen pad up front where you can key in your phone number for specials; it is immediately impressed upon you that quality is important to the owners here.  That is further confirmed for when you try the food. :) Ingredients make the difference, and you get what you pay for here.   Lastly, there are really comfortable seating arrangements here: different types of chairs inside, so that you can relax outside, lounge on some of the soft seats inside, or sit up at the bar on the stools. Either way yields more than enough comfort to suit your mood; whether you are staying for a while or on the go, there is no way to go wrong.     I will be back. A LOT. Hope you will get to enjoy also! :)

I ordered from this place on Postmates. I got some oatmeal which wasn't bad but definitely wasn't anything to write home about. The Lavender Honey Latte was delicious. The chicken on the Chicken and Waffles was BURNT. Not "oops, we didn't notice that one side got a bit more heat than the other" but all around speckles of black. There's no way the cook did not see it while packing this up. It went straight in the trash where it belonged in the first place!

This restaurant serves dinner Thursday, Friday & Saturday. The dinner menu is brief but excellent. It's ramen, but NOTHING like ramen noodles. You select your broth, noodles, protein, and extras. Everything is delicious and very filling. I highly recommend the beef pot stickers. Yum!

No one greeted me at the door to explain how the place works, but I figured it out. Order first, then sit and they will bring you your food. That's it for customer service. After paying $16 for the lobster Cobb salad I realized they forgot to put the avocado on. There was no one around to help me unless I took the dish back up to the counter and waited in line again. So I ate it without, no biggie. The salad was okay. Not $16 worth, just okay.

Chestnut has potential to be amazing, unfortunately my experience was mediocre at best.   I have been wanting to go to Chestnut for the past year but rarely make it past 32nd st on Camelback. Why? I'm not too sure. Either way, I made a mental note to make this my destination for today.   The decor is beautiful. I love the yellow and grey. Not only are the colors bright but there is a ton of natural light. The center of the restaurant is the coffee bar/baked goods/regular bar/juice bar, and there is seating on the far side.  My lady and I each ordered a sandwich, grilled cheese for me, some sort of club for her and we each ordered the lemonade. I asked for bacon on the grilled cheese but it came without so I double checked to make sure I hadn't been charged. The guy who took our order didn't hear me order it I guess, therefore he didn't charge me for it. The grilled cheese does come with tomato on it. It was small, but delicious. The club was descent but nothing to get excited over. Best part of the sandwich was the Noble bread. As for the lemonade, way too tart.  After we ate we ordered a couple baked goods, a snickerdoodle for me and a pecan bar for her. They were also just ok. While she was up at the counter ordering, I was watching what was going on in the bar area and what I could see in the kitchen. I watched the guy who was making juice, grab a glove out of a mason jar. Thought it was kind of odd but figured they did that for decor purposes. Later I saw one of the employees filling it with gloves, but not wearing any while doing it. Kind of kills the purpose, don't you think?  I doubt I will return. I came, I saw, I conquered, and I left disappointed. It's a great spot but nothing to get excited over.
Love love LOVE their new menu!!! Also can't wait for the cinnamon rolls at Christmas! Takes the work out of Christmas morning breakfast for me

Great breakfast sandwich (sandi) and atmosphere. Staff was very attentive and friendly. I will definitely be back to try more of the menu and pastries. Three stars because it's breakfast, but it was delicious.

Pretty average food. Not good enough to justify the prices. Abysmal service. The three dishes for three people arrived 15  -20 minutes apart. No apologies. Not checking on us. No water until we asked and then given small plastic cups of water.  No one ever returned to refill. Never going back.

I don't have enough good things to say about this restaurant! My fiancé and I started going here a while back after we saw our favorite wrestlers Daniel and Brie Bryan rave about this restaurant so we knew we had to try it. When we got here it far exceeded our expectations with the service, environment and quality of food. We drive almost 2 hours just to eat here and every time we are no where near disappointed! The restaurant itself is super clean, chic and very "at home" the food is high quality and delicious and the staff if always kind and helpful!

When a family member suggested this place to meet for lunch, I was almost afraid to come after reading horrible reviews. I believe that those lowly reviews were given a little too prematurely considering the place just opened.   When we arrived, we were pleasantly greeted by staff. I got a green goddess salad and a gardener juice. The veggies were freshly cut and tasted robust. My husband ordered the lobster cobb salad that he enjoyed. His daughters got the chestnut chopped salad that tasted delicious. All our salads just had the right amount of dressing allowing you to taste the freshness of the organic ingredients.  Seating is quite limited inside but they do have several tables at their patio area. They also have a flower shop in the restaurant. Before we left we ordered chocolate chip cookies to go after hearing how good they were. They were not greasy and a great munchy ;) please check my photos for ingredients of our salads. You will want to try their food out after viewing them. Give them a chance. These little places serving healthy meals are quite beneficial to the community and bad reviews could cause a loss in business that not only hurt business owners but employees as well. Please check them out yourselves before forming an opinion although I would stay away from anything with the English muffin that had been consistently bashed.   Here's a link to their menu:  http://chestnutaz.com/ChestnutMenu.pdf
Nice atmosphere, coffee and bacon. The English muffin wasn't very good nor was the $10 juice.
Love breakfast and love the ramen! The breakfast vibe is always great lots of indoor and outdoor seating.

Parking is all but impossible and super frustrating. The vibe is pretty urban chill inside and comfortable.   The menu is limited for my personal taste. That being said, the short rib sandwich is real good and the sweet potato chips are pretty tasty. I will get the lobster roll if I ever return.

I went here with a friend just for a quick bite to eat. The location is ok but the parking is terrible. We walk in and nobody greets us. We walk to the register and place our orders. I ordered the blueberry pancakes but when my plate hit the table, I knew what the waitress delivered was not the blueberry pancakes I ordered. I was tired of waiting so I just ate what I was given. Not the greatest customer service and the food isn't stellar

We waited in anticipation for Chestnuts to open as we enjoy a great breakfast or lunch out in our neighborhood.  We had a guest in town, so we thought we'd give it a shot.  We were not prepared for the "order at the counter and scramble to try to get a seat" scenario. There are only about 10 indoor tables. Several patio tables, but too cold to sit outside. We hovered over a table that was about to be vacated.  We were seated at least 10 minutes without any gesture for the table to be cleaned so we cleared the table ourselves.  We had to flag down a hurried waiter to bring us silverware.  No attempt was made to wipe or disinfect the table.  We scored the last table near the children's play area.  Seems like a good concept for parent's of small children.  Two toddlers were placed there to eat their breakfast from the low (filthy) play table.  From watching the children eat with their hands and then touching the toys, it seemed like a breeding ground for bacteria.  Our 2 lobster rolls and club sandwich came in a timely manner.  The lobster rolls which were overly doused with spicy remoulade drowned out any flavor of the lobster. The club sandwich was overly toasted and very bland.  A stark contrast from the spiceness of the lobster roll!  I asked for a side of mayonnaise just to give it some taste.  The maple bacon was the only salvation on the sandwich.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is noisy and hurried.  Not conducive to a leisurely relaxing breakfast or lunch (especially with customers waiting to snatch the next available table.  Sorry to say that we were disappointed and won't be back.

This place is awesome. Super calm vibe. Nice staff. Very helpful when I asked questions about the menu. Food was delicious. I ordered the egg salad sandwich. Which is to die for, by the way. Clean. Not much more to say than that. I'd recommend it to anyone for lunch/brunch. Outdoor and indoor seating.

First let's get one thing out of the way,  pastry there is always 5 stars, however I have been there twice and always something important has been left out of my salad. I had the lobster salad yesterday and asked for the egg to be left out due to me not liking egg, but then they left out the corn! The corn is one of the most important ingredients.  I didn't go to the counter and mention it as I was with a friend and a small child. Also my lobster was overcooked which is sad for a salad.  As we left my friend mentioned her salad was missing the nuts,  so I knew that I needed to review.  Owners if you are reading this time to go wake up or shake up your salad person.   The last time I was there same thing happened with my quinoa salad- ingredients missing.

Guy walks into a restaurant and looks up at the menu board and orders a sandwich for $9. Hipster cashier overcharges me and I ask why and he shows me the written menu with new prices (it was 50 cents more now). Cashier turns to manager, who is wearing black nail polish, and says we need to change the menu board prices. Nail polish boy doesn't say anything to me or cashier and keeps eating his soup. Normally, this is where I go off on anybody in sight, but I let it go cause I wanted to try this Billy Club. It was pretty good, but the bread needed to be softer for easier biting. All the ingredients were fairy high level including real turkey.     Obviously you cannot change your written prices and "forget" to change the menu board that 100% of people are actually looking at to order. Throw in the fact that a dude was wearing nail polish and I will find another turkey sandwich somewhere else where the employees and management aren't this lazy and inept.  UPDATE to Owner Response 2/1/16 I wasn't there on a Sunday. It was during the week. Plus your flat out lying. You have been open since at least 2014, so your telling me that the menu board prices have been wrong since you opened the doors? Cmon, if that's true then yes you are lazy and inept.

It was ok.... not the best but ok.... they don't have happy hour, came here on a Friday with a group of friends and the waitress was really nice but we waited about 20-30  for our tab. I believe she was the only waitress, but overall the food wasn't worth the drive.SMALL portions for the price, at first i thought i was overcharged when i saw my bill. They don't provide the prices on drinks bc they're so expensive. Never again...... Maybe it should've been named the CHEST-NOT!

I have come here several times for coffee and pastries. The Mama's Cold Brew is delicious and the pastries are just okay. But, the service is hit or miss - frequently a little too cool for school. This morning I paid $13 for a large iced coffee and a pop tart and it's probably the last time I'll be in because, well, that's just dumb. I'm pretty sure the coffee was like $9. I'll just go to AJ's across the street from now on.
I come here for brunch often, it's a great place with delicious food! The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the service is fast. Great place!
Came here tonight for noodles :-) so delicious :-) All the staff super warm and genuine-- spicy pork with rice noodles an absolute must!! Potstickers = amazing!

We stopped in for a quick snack mid day.  I have been meaning to try.  Had a great cold brewed coffee with lavender honey. My friend enjoyed a salad. It's not terribly big, and i can see it being crowded if you came with a party of more than 2 people around lunch.  I will def stop in again, there were more than 5 things I wanted to try. The staff was friendly and accommodating... Lots of samples to taste on the counter too!

This review is for Water Chestnut which is their ramen menu offered Thursday - Saturday evenings. I've been here twice for ramen and it is so delicious! They have a build-your-own type style where you can choose the broth, type of noodle, protein and toppings. Both times I've had the Chinese sausage with garlic shoyu, soft egg, & nori and it was awesome! The sausage, while not a traditional ingredient is sweet and savory and adds a nice amount of flavor. I find the portions size to be decent, I haven't been able to finish. Their craft cocktails are also very inventive with fresh ingredients. While my husband and I were finishing our dinner the chef came out to ask how everything was, she then told us that everything is homemade including the dumpling skins. We will definitely have to come back and try some of the smaller bites next time.
These people should really get new management. Drove 15 miles to have dinner and they closed 45 minutes early. Don't waste your time going. I will not be back.

Let's start this review by saying, you need to go try their iced coffee. It is fantastic. I mean just the plain 'ol cold brew iced coffee, no cream, no sugar. Delicious.   I love this place! It reminds me of little urban coffee shops on the east coast mixed with that Northern California Farmer's Market / Artisanal twist.   They are a little on the pricey side. One morning it was close to $9 for an iced coffee and a side of eggs. The eggs were perfectly cooked.  All of their ingredients are very fresh. I had the kale salad which unfortunately had too many raisins for my liking, but they were easy to pick out.   One of my cousins had the French toast that she was not particularly impressed by so she grabbed a pastry that she enjoyed instead.   My other cousin got the eggs benedict with arugula that she loved. Entrée envy. We were treated with great service.  They also offer flower bouquets from the camelback flower shop. They're gorgeous. I have to stop myself from splurging every time I go in there.   I definitely recommend this if you are in town. They also have a little area to entertain the kiddos while mom and pop have a date.

I quite enjoy the healthy breakfasts at Chestnut, but the music selection this morning makes me want to kill myself.   Like for real, brunch and electronic Indie pop do not go together. I'm looking at Camelback Mountain right now, not a nightclub DJ with side bangs. This is killing my chill, morning-ish vibe. If your poached eggs weren't so damn perfect, I'd leave. The person in charge of today's playlist must be the same person who convinced my mom to get a Panic! At the Disco CD the last time she went to a Best Buy.  *So I thought I'd update this in fairness, as someone reached out and mentioned they're always happy to change the music selection. Now I feel bad for being a music snob, but life is hard when you have good taste. They really do have perfect healthy breakfasts. Good enough to endure any music selection. I'm sorry. If I forgive your love of emo, will you forgive my sense of humor?

We popped in here for a quick breakfast on my Birthday and it was delicious! We wanted something light since we knew that we were going out for lunch and dinner also, and Chestnut provided just that.   I ordered The Sandi with prosciutto served on a pepper roll with an over easy egg, gruyere, arugula, and truffle aioli {this is what sold me!}. The bun was light and airy, and the sandwich was delicious. The only thing that I would have wished for was some fruit on the side. For $8 you get the sandi only and I didn't really want to pay extra for a side. I guess I didn't need it THAT bad. ;) I also had some of their mango iced tea which was refreshing and very flavorful!  My fiance got the baked oatmeal and loved it!!! Especially the cinnamon apple compote on top.  They also sell Mama's Cold Brew - YES, please! Since it is near my house, this is where i'll be buying it from now on! SO YUM!
The coffee was the worst coffee I have ever had.  Words Can't describe the bad flavor of the latte.  The almond croissant was excellent.

Long wait for the food. You order at the counter then go sit down, good idea but need to have multiple registers. Big group in front of us. Sat down at the counter. Took about 45 minutes for the food to arrive, eggs on toast were bad. The Scramble was delicious was the only thing worth the wait

The Chestnut has recently opened for dinner service under the name Water Chestnut. The menu is a sheer delight. Delicious cocktails and appetizers of steamed edamame prepared 3 different ways - we tried garlic and then the spicy chili. Both were just on point! Then we had the vegetarian potstickers and the spring rolls. We were fighting over them and ended up ordering 2 more plates! Get this - the plum sauce they are served with is homemade from actual plums. Not canned, fresh plums! For entrees, we had 2 different ramen dishes. OMG! Soooo good!!! 3 different broths, 3 different noodle choices, plenty of proteins (we had 1 duck and 1 tofu - I was the solo omnivore with 4 vegetarians and BONUS because I didn't have to share!), then lots of different additions like chili sweet corn, garlic spinach, and more! The owner and her mother checked on us and chatted with us to ensure we were happy diners. We learned about the different flavor compositions, how they enjoy what they do and their passion is completely evident in their food. You can seriously taste the love! Then we finished up with black sesame ice cream and some sweet little sesame and red bean paste orbs that were just unbelievable! We rolled ourselves out of there and were all super excited to have a new family  restaurant in the hood for DINNER!! Can't wait to return - one catch - dinner is only Thurs - Saturday - get it soon, you will be SO PLEASED YOU DID!!!
Awesome food for lunch Monday through Saturday and awesome food for dinner on Thursday, Friday and Saturday!!!!! We love the ramen noodle in this friendly space with lovely people!!!

This review is of the 'Water Chestnut' evening concept - and, more specifically, my daughter and I went for Ramen Night (Thu-Fri night - Tip:  If you get there during happy hour, Ramen is $2 off.)  We started off with the Short Rib Bao - normally, Bao is a steamed bun, but these were served taco-style - either way, they were tasty!  Good way to get your meal off to a rockin' start!  On to the Ramen - First, you choose your broth (Pork Shoyu for me), then a noodle (house ramen), then protein (bbq pork) then add-ins (spicy sesame chili sweet corn and a soft egg).  The broth was pretty good, and the noodles were cooked properly.  The pork was good and the egg was perfect (my daughter went with the soy egg, which is hard boiled, but she thought the soy overpowered the egg).    It was a good bowl of ramen.    We enjoyed our dinner, and will head back some time soon!!

Chestnut Fine Food & Provisions is a hidden gem located in the heart of Scottsdale located off of Camelback and 44th Street. Chestnut is a vintage cottage type place with a touch of modern with the bright yellow and grey coloring throughout that offers both indoor and outside seating. What an oasis! It's similar to the restaurant Sauce Pizza & Wine in a way hence the food. You order at the counter, pick a number, and seat yourself and a food runner/server will bring you your food! They offer both breakfast + lunch, juices, coffee, tea, and a full bar! Their menu is super fun and "homey". They do a modern twist on simple dishes and adds their own touch.   Breakfast  I have a little bit of a sweet tooth so my breakfast "go to" is their Lemon Ricotta Waffles! Belgian waffles cut into four wedges, lemon ricotta cheese with a blueberry compote! So yummy!! I've also had their Banana Bread Pancakes which is another popular menu option along with the waffles which is topped with candied walnuts and orange zest! Their Salmon toast is also very delicious! Comes on a toasted bread with salmon, sautéed kale and scramble eggs!   Lunch  Haven't gotten to experiment much with their lunch menu, but I've had their Grilled Cheese Sammie and Lobster Cobb salad. Both super yummy!!   Services is always super friendly and fast! I absolutely love that they have a play area for the kiddos to keep them occupied! My daughter has had plenty of play dates here! I've been here on many different occasions whether it's brunch and mimosas with the girls, or breakfast with the fam Chestnut makes each visit enjoyable! Never have had a bad experience! I live in west Phoenix, but if I'm ever in the area I will always make a trip to Chestnut.

Chestnut baked oatmeal was divine! Cinnamon apple compote, honeyed walnuts and creme fraiche, so, so, good! Great vibe, sat out front on the patio, charming decor, great Cartel coffee, perfect way to start my week!
I didn't care for the order at the counter, but the Banana French Toast pancakes were fabulous? The decor is wonderful and quaint. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Unfortunately, this was my first (and last) time at Chestnut. The person at the counter was in a rush to get us out--with only two people behind us. When I asked if I could get a lavender latte that's not 24oz he said there's no way that he can do that, but I can drink any other drink in a smaller size. That was all okay. But when I went to eat their blueberry muffin, the top totally crumbled and the muffin is raw. No thanks. Mama's cold brew is good. But, I will stick to getting it from other local businesses.
Love Love love this place! Great food, great staff, and great atmosphere! Best oatmeal, banana protein pancakes, lemon ricotta Belgium waffles, maple bacon and coffee! I'm not kidding! A must try!!!

Love, love, love Chestnut. It's a relaxed atmosphere, not chaotic at all like some Arcadia brunch places. Every time I've been to visit the person working the counter has been really helpful in their suggestions and also recommending their baked goods. The last time I went, I had the Bahn Mi and it is probably my favorite thing on their menu. Crusty French bread, deliciously tangy vegetables, it's also huge so you'll be more than full with half.   Their cold press is good. Just a nice place to have meal with friends and the price is good.

I love this spot in Arcadia. The winter sunshine salad as well as the short ribs are fantastic. If you order to-go, there is convenient parking spot for their customers to pick up food. Breakfast is a must try as the cinnamon rolls are delicious. Enjoy!

On a trip to Arizona a friend recommended this place. So glad she did. We had the bahn mi sandwich and the short rib sandwich..both very flavorful and the spicy pickled cucumbers were delicious. The bahn mi was fresh with just the right amount of heat and the 5spice chicken was tender and moist. The short rib sandwich melts in your mouth..fall apart goodness of flavors...great place to eat for a healthy option. Definitely will visit again on another trip

This used to be a place I recommended to friends and family, however I am here to warn everyone. In April I stopped in for a quick bite on a Sunday. The place was not busy. I ordered a turkey sandwich. They use toothpicks to hold their sandwiches together. I pulled out the toothpick and continued to read my paper. I did not notice the toothpick was broken and subsequently I bit into and swallowed part of the section of the toothpick that remained inside the sandwich. I showed the cashier what happened and she asked me if I was ok, and refunded my money right away. I sat in my car wondering what to do, since it felt like the pick was stuck in my throat. Well I went to the emergency room since I was concerned and they took Exrays. Just heard from the insurance company they will not cover my medical charges. Buyer be aware they won't take responsibility for broken toothpicks in the food they serve. What a shame.  Regarding the response I received, really?! Kirsten doesn't your insurance company represent your establishment? Ok the ex rays did not show any foreign object, because I had swallowed it. The doctor said it likely scratched my throat which is why it felt like something was still there. I still wasted my afternoon at the hospital and experienced fear and discomfort due to the carelessness of whomever made my meal. The most expensive meal of my life.

A group of six of us went for brunch today and loved it! Atmosphere is wonderful and food was delicious. I loved the banana bread pancakes and my girlfriend LOVED the lemon ricotta waffles. Also tried the lavender honey iced latte and it was great. The service was friendly and upbeat, food came very fast, and the chef checked on our table multiple times. What a great addition to a wonderful neighborhood, we'll be back!

I'm actually pretty sure I've been to more cafes/coffee bars this week than I can count, but I know I made a stop here also in the past week.   I've been here once before and while I thought the actual inside was beyond gorgeous, I wasn't wowed by the lavender latte that I had here (probably a year a go) and just never came back. I also don't really enjoy the parking lot right there on the corner, but nothing you can do about that.  This time I decided to go for the cold brew, and I didn't do the mamas cold brew, because that to me has too much cinnamon, and is kind of overpowering. I got the one chestnut makes in house, and it didn't even need creamer or sugar! I also got a delicious maple scone that I'm day dreaming about. Also, if you get the chestnut cold brew you get free refills!   I will say I haven't tried much of the food but I will be back for it!
Love it here! Service is on point. Healthy and quick. Also check out the cute satellite Camelback Flower Shop.
Ordered "chestnut salad" Not fresh at all. Every ingredient was about 2-3 days old resulting in a very disappointing lunch. May try something else in the future cause the location is decent.

We were in the mood for an impromptu picnic yesterday, so decided to stop by to make that happen.  The decor of the space is bright and very welcoming...the staff was too. I ordered the proscuitto and brie sandwich with sweet potato chips for both of us and we were pleased - nothing extraordinary, but just plain good.

I had the mashed avocado toast with poached egg and red pepper flakes. Really good the bread was nice and thick but soft. I enjoyed it! My friend had the toast with bacon jam, he loved his. Coffee was delicious- I had a hazelnut latte, those beans are delicious! Maple oat scone wasn't very "maple" tasting it was ok, more pat, good just not maplely. I would come back for more breakfast!

The parking lot is a one-way street and many of the spaces are reserved for other businesses so if you find a spot, just take it!   When you enter, look for a cash register because that's where you order before taking a seat.  There is a lot of seating inside and outside the restaurant and some tables are more private than others. Chestnut has a trendy casual atmosphere with a touch of modern.  I gave the club sandwich a shot with an iced green tea and the meal came with crispy sweet potato chips. The tea is refreshing and high quality. Food here is made with fresh organic ingredients which translates into a tasty meal.  Overall a decent experience, however, if they lowered their prices I would come here more often.

This trendy brunch spot is a must!!! From their homemade cold brew to delicious breakfast to their bright, eclectic atmosphere (including cute, local goods to purchase) this place has it all!   My favorite is their lemon ricotta blueberry waffles. They're fresh, fruity, and not too heavy! I love grabbing a seat by the window and soaking up the sun while I wait for my food. I also love to order the honey lavender latte - it's so tasty! My friends love their quinoa bowls and banana bread pancakes as well.   The atmosphere of this place really knocks it out of the park. It's like a beautiful, bright farmers market in there. The service is fantastic as well. Once, when my order was mistaken, they not only brought me my correct order, but gave me a comp for my next time in! They will go above and beyond to make sure your experience is the best.   Be sure to grab some cold brew and a treat on your way out!
This place has THE best gluten free cookies and Lattes I've ever had. Everything is so fresh and the staff is super accommodating. This is a must stop for Americanos and Lattes on my Phoenix stops.
Very yummy! Love to come here when I'm on this side of town for yummy teas or coffee and treats :) the breakfast is delicious as is lunch!

My friend and I went to Chestnut for the first time today for lunch and I think it has great potential. Since it's in Arcadia, parking is a challenge of course, but there is a valet option. The atmosphere is lively and bright. You order at the counter and then you are given a number and your food is brought to you at your table. We sat outside which was nice but a little noisy since you're facing Camelback.    I had the lobster roll which is wonderful! As another reviewer mentioned, it is not the typical mayo-based lobster roll. There is a wonderful spicy remoulade which doesn't overpower the lobster and it's on a very good toasty baguette. The prickly pear iced tea is also very good.   My friend had the Ficelles which is the prosciutto and brie sandwich and she said it was "just ok".   We both agreed that the best part of the experience were the chocolate chip cookies, don't leave without indulging in one (or more) of those. I'll definitely be back to try some other items and to get more cookies!

Chestnut is at a great location in Scottsdale, but the food is ok. The restaurant is clean, spacious and trendy. The sweet potato chips are delicious, however, the sandwiches are nothing to write home about. If you're looking for a quick bite, I'd come here, but I wouldn't impress my ex-mother-in-law with this place.

Very average.  Seemed disorganized as far as where to order.  Waited an exceptionally long time for my latte.  Menu not very exciting and little options if you would like to go gluten free. LGO is a better choice for options and atmosphere.

Popped in here for some grub on a Monday afternoon and had a delightful lobster roll. The atmosphere inside is bright, neat, clean and cheerful. However the girl I dealt with behind the counter who took my order didn't seem too thrilled with her job and was very curt and unhelpful. Had I gotten friendlier service, I'd have given this place 5 stars. At least I know the food is good, and hopefully on my next visit, I'll get both a yummy meal and service with a smile.

I'm glad my expectations were not high (thank you Yelp!). Such a cute place, with so much potential... But so much competition on neighboring streets in Arcadia, where good food really is *everywhere*.   I came here on a Sunday for brunch w friends. They had small dishes of samples of baked goods on the display case, so that being my favorite thing I went for it. Blech. So awful. The blueberry scone/cake thing was absolutely rubbery and tasteless. No flavor. The shortbread cookie with pistachios was also lacking any distinct flavor. I ordered a small maple oat scone, which was at least edible but, please- for the love of God- hire a new baker!! It is NOT hard to bake. I'd rather waste my calories at LA Grande Orange down the street.   My friend ordered the tofu bahn mi which was pretty delicious. It came with sweet posts to chips which were good. The toast he ordered came to the table stale and cold. Really??   Get your shiz together, this is Arcadia....

Menu is really exciting, and the food is pretty good, but service is terrible!! Basically expect to be on your own in terms of finding condiments, water, etc. Also, if you ask any questions about the menu, you will be looked at like you are stupid.
