I work next door to Chestnut and would walk there for coffee/lunch from time to time, the food is average and no complaints on the food. The coffee service on the other hand... not the best. I've waited over 20 minutes for coffee on more than one occasion, I didn't mind so much because I work so close and it would have been the same amount of time if I were to drive else where for coffee. What really irked me was today, I walked over there for a coffee at 2:00pm and the girl working the coffee stations refused to make me anything because they closed at 2pm. When I last looked, they closed at 4pm. I would have been okay with it, but the cashier was extremely rude towards me and there was someone ahead of me and she took her order, but not mine. I understand hours of operations may change, but if she was polite about it, I would have been a little more understanding.

Chestnut is kind of an island oasis in an ocean of the trendy and overrated.   First off their service is kind and genuine.  Couldn't help myself but to sample the home baked chocolate chip cookies after an early Camelback hike. I'm a dude so my tastes are basic (they have a lots of great brunch menu choices) actually stopped in for breakfast was going to have the oatmeal which I've had before (it's perfect)but had the breakfast burrito instead.  You can choose from a great list of ingredients.  It arrived quickly, with very fresh tomatillo salsa and a cup of fresh kiwi, strawberries, blueberries and pineapple, perfect touch.  Back to those cookies, absolutely reminded me of my Mom's, what a treat.  If you have the chance to meet Nina, she's just truly a wonderful, beautiful, caring and sweet person.  Great place, never a line.   Ahhhhhh.   Def recommend.
Great coffee and the desserts were amazing!!  Try the carrot cake!  I have not had a meal here, but plan to soon.

Delicious food, great atmosphere. I little pricey, but definitely worth it. The food is so fresh and yum. The baked goods are to die for!!!  Also tried Water Chestnut at night, and it was the best ramen I've tasted in the Valley. Great cocktails and appetizers. A must try!

Went here before a play with the girls and had ramen. So good. We sat outside and terrific atmosphere and service.   A little difficult to get to parking lot but once there really enjoyed it for my first experience eating ramen in a restaurant. Drinks were also very tasty as well.
My favorite place to brunch! Love the food, mamas cold brew, and atmosphere. This is my restaurant of choice to meet friends. Love Water Chestnuts too on the weekends!

When I first walked in I fell in love with the decor. It is clean, fun, trendy and still felt high end. There was only one couple in line in front of us and they let us order first because they could not decide what they wanted to eat. The staff was nice, clean and had a hip vib.  We ordered and found a seat easily and our drinks came out right away. I had the Sandi, a breakfast sandwich with honeyed bacon, cheese (I cant remember what type), arugula with an egg. The flavors played off each other well. I think for the type of food being served their price point is spot on. The only thing I did not care for was the coffee, it is probably a great coffee for people who cream and sugar but not for black coffee, in my opinion. Our food arrived in a timely fashion too.  There was a steady flow of customers and everyone seemed to be pleased.  I plan on trying it out again next time I am in the area.
I have always had a great experience here. The food is always really good and the staff is always friendly. I highly recommend Chestnut.

If you want a great dining experience, don't go to Chestnut Fine Foods and Provisions in Phoenix. Just don't.  You'll walk in to the breakfast and lunch spot, like I did on a recent Sunday morning, and you'll be greeted by a  crowd of people standing in disorganized lines to order -- not exactly a relaxing way to start your breakfast.  Then, they'll be out of your favorite drink -- in my friend's case, it was the Lavender Honey Iced Latte. The person taking your order won't be friendly, just indifferent. Even when you tip more than 20 percent at this order-at-the-counter eatery, don't expect great service.  The girl who delivers the coffee latte you had to settle on will scowl as she sets it down on your table, which, by the way, has no silverware or napkins.  Now, the fun part -- my pal and I waited 30 minutes for our food, watching as tables who sat down after us received theirs. When my pal finally asked what was up, we found out our ticket had been "burned" -- meaning the order had mistakenly been perceived as already delivered -- which means our food hadn't even started to be cooked. This message was delivered by the sous-chef, who actually told my friend and I, "I'm delivering the food because everyone in the kitchen is messing up." If only that was followed by an, "And your meal is free because we're giving sucky service today."  My friend received her coffee 15 minutes before I got my orange juice, and when we finally got our food, the disappointing experience continued. Sure, my Lemon Ricotta Waffles ($7.25) were OK, but my friend's Green Eggs and Ham ($7.50), she said, was horrible. It came with poached eggs, prosciutto, pesto and arugula on an English muffin, and she said the English muffin was hard, the egg was runny, there wasn't enough pesto, and the ham was undercooked. Even if I wasn't vegetarian, I would still think that was really gross.  Maybe we would have left with a better taste in our mouths if the people working at the Chestnut actually seemed like they cared about the people eating there. For now, I'd recommend never going there. Ever.

Water Chestnut at night (Thurs-Sat) brings ramen to Arcadia! Hands down a top 3 ramen joint in all of the Phoenix metro. Add their amazing short rib bao and edamame and you've got the best Pan-Asian dinner around.

Recently went here for a lunch with a girlfriend and by reading some of the reviews my expectations weren't too high. While walking in I loved the decor! Such a cute place for breakfast/brunch/lunch. My girlfriend had the Kale Salad with Salmon and I had the Green Goddess. We decided to sit on the patio since the weather was so nice. Our salads came back and they were very good size portions. I LOVED my Green Goddess Salad. It had some spice to it but the flavor was very good and I was happy that I had some noodles in every bite after mixing it all up. The service was good and everyone was friendly. I certainly will be back to try more things.

Ordered lobster salad. It was disappointing that lobster was deep fried. Lobster was so well done that it was hard and chewy. Whole salad did not look appetizing. Husband had tuna salad sandwich, was just ok for him. Side of sweet potato chips were not crispy.. A bit stale. He did love the cookies.

I'm no longer a fan of this cafe and here is why: I needed to get some flowers for my wife yesterday afternoon. It was one of those "I should probably get her flowers." moments where husbands sometimes find themselves.  Previously, we had eaten at Chestnut and browsed in Camelback Flowershop which is located inside the cafe. The woman working there that day was friendly and gave my wife their card and had hand written on it that on Fridays from 1-6pm they offer "Fresh Flower Happy Hour". It just so happened to be Friday afternoon that I needed to buy a bouquet. I didn't have our car that day, and called my friend to come pick me up and drive me over to the store. We arrived at 445pm. Chestnut closes in the early afternoon so of course the door was locked but I imagined their would some way to access the flower shop therein. We tried all the doors: all locked. I called the flower shop: no answer but the voicemail message said they were open at that time. I could see about 3 adults behind the bar inside Chestnut milling around, one was clearly staff cleaning, but the others looked like possibly owners/management. Someone's child was just inside the door playing with toys. I knocked, and the adults were clearly doing their best to not make eye contact because I was the dumb customer who clearly didn't know how to read the hours of operation sign. I KNEW they were closed I just wanted to find out why I couldn't get into the flower shop that was supposed to be open. We went around to the patio door and I mimed to them that I was trying to buy flowers. They looked away perturbed.  So here's the thing: there are many flower shops in Phoenix. There are also a million places to eat in this area. But by not being open during advertised hours and not posting a sign or leaving an outgoing voicemail on the service with an explanation as to why I can't do business at CBFS during their clearly posted business hours, this shop has failed me as a potential repeat client. I understand life happens, emergencies arise, but it takes seconds to jot a note and stick it in the window: "Sorry we had to close early today. Please come again! :)"  Chestnut failed because there I was standing there in 110 degree heat being made a fool of. Would it have KILLED the Chestnut people to come over, open the door and tell me why the flower shop is not open? Was it really necessary for me to stand there looking at them ignoring me, a former customer? Customer service is a dying art and is common courtesy apparently. I'm more disappointed in the Chestnut people as they were THERE.  But I will tell you: the flowers I bought at Safeway are beautiful, and neither I nor my friend will ever spend any money at Chestnut again. Which is too bad cuz it's close to home and has decent food. But so will the new Matt's Big Breakfast opening soon at the Safeway mall at 32nd St. where I will be able to get brunch and flowers in the future.

Ambiance: Large restaurant that wraps around its center bar. Has about 12 tables indoors, bar has about 12 stools, and outside patio with another 12 tables. Decor is very modern, lots of natural light with ceiling to floor windows replacing walls. Indie music plays somewhat louder than the average cafe. Patrons are mostly 30 something's and older, wealthy Scottsdaleans.   Food:  I went with the Granger and was pleasantly surprised. The salmon was perfect, not dried out. The poached Eggs could have been pulled out sooner but I'm a egg snob. The best part was the sautéed kale, WOW. I could eat that all day. The avocado/tomatoes were great as well. I had a fresh squeezed OJ which was worth the price. The toast was ok but prob not worth the extra 1.50.  Price/Service: Definitely expensive but you are paying for quality foods, hard to gauge but I would say it overall was worth the price. Food came out quick, so no complaints.  Overall: A great spot if you're abreakfast snob....Also a great post-Echo Canyon hike Breakfast spot.
Tuna melt and peach iced tea were amazing. Staff was friendly and on the ball. Everyone was busy working, cleaning, helping. Awesome patio. Loved it!!
I could make this a regular morning spot! Great atmosphere, friendly faces, and one BOMB bowl of granola. Get the caramel apple cider.. delicious. And the pumpkin pancakes.. nuff said

I came here for breakfast, it wasn't too busy. Seems like a cute cafe, order at the front register and they bring it out.   Cashier was friendly and helpful. I ordered a breakfast burrito. Pretty good and filling.   Restaurant and restrooms seem pretty clean. The patrons also seem polite, looks like a nice hangout spot to catch up with friends and talk with coffee.   I saw they had ramen too, but think they serve that dinner time only.   If I'm in the area next time, I'll be sure to check it out!
The ramen was great, took the recommendation from my waiter. The eggrolls I got for my appetizer were soggy/chewy and were bland. Very cute inside
The food is delicious and made with high quality ingredients.  I love the creative atmosphere and helpfulness of the staff!  A+ in my book!  I will be back next time I'm in town

Amazing! It has only been 8 days since they opened, and it is running smooth, friendly and delicious. Bibimbap bowl is so tasty and off the beaten path. We also had the sando and it is tooooo good. Yum. Can't wait to come back.
Mediocre ramen, average service, had old menus with discontinued food that looked better than the food available.  No refills to soda.  You are much better off going somewhere else.

Was looking forward to my first experience here.  While the food was ok, the presentation of the brunch was not appealing.  The plates it was served on were disgustingly scuffed up.  The silverware was low end.  Forks were easily bent. We sat outside on Camelback Rd side and no one was out there to wipe off tables and pick up napkins off the ground. I really wanted this to be a good experience as its a great location.   I would blame management for lack of supervision.  Not enough staff during peak hours. Banana bread pancakes were excellent.

I'm a little bit bummed that I can only give this place 3 stars- I really wanted to love it. Ive been wanting to come here forever and finally did a post hike brunch with some girlfriends. The service at the register was polite, you could tell she was new and was a little slow but no biggie there. I ordered the Sandi with turkey, bacon, arugula, gruyere, a poached egg, and truffle aioli served on a pepper roll. It was... just ok. I don't know why something with that many flavorful ingredients was so average, bordering on bland- I had to get an extra side of the aioli to add more flavor. My poached egg was overdone where the yolk wasn't runny at all which made me sad. On the upside- the portions were large and there was a lot of meat on the sandwich that I liked. I got a bloody mary and my friends got mimosas- they were ok. I love the location so much and the vibe of the place so I'm not ruling out a future visit to try something different on the menu- i just don't think I'll be in a hurry.

Amazing coffee shop/breakfast and lunch spot with a lovely, cheery interior, fresh food and great service. The baked oatmeal with apples was a real standout, as was the smoked salmon toast with kale and eggs.

I specifically came here for their ramen menu that they started for the evenings on Thursday, Friday and Saturday. I was really confused why a breakfast and brunch place would start serving ramen at night. But the ramen wasn't that bad. It was a little small in portion in my opinion but the overall bowl was pretty good if not really good.  I would say they are competing for first place for best tasting ramen with the new Nishikawa location. I think Nishikawa has better and thicker broth (depending if you get the tonkatsu there) but their noodles are questionable. The ramen at Chestnut has better noodles as in actual ramen noodles even though you can get buckwheat noodles which I am not a fan of.  I would say I like the ramen I got which was the Garlic Pork Miso with regular ramen and a soft boiled egg. The egg was truly soft boiled because you can pop the yolk. The noodles were springy and didn't go soft after being in the broth. The broth had flavor and some depth to it... like they actually put more than seasoning into it. The bbq pork as a topping came out really well and complimented the flavor. Usually I expect pork slices that melt in your mouth but in this case, it was still very tasty. So I give this place a really good recommendation for pretty good ramen compared to other places in AZ.

I met a colleague here for lunch. She had the grilled cheese sandwich and I had the salmon and couscous salad. I was impressed with my salad - generous portion, good flavors, something I'd never put in the effort to make for myself.   I'd never been to this restaurant before and I found the parking situation a bit confusing. All the spaces for Chestnut up front were taken so I had to park around the back in the parking area shared with the nearby office buildings. I was surprised that you ordered at the counter and seated yourself. Something about the website made me think that there would be table service.   The atmosphere was casual and comfortable - but a bit too noisy for my liking. I also liked that they had dog bowls near the front door, so I suspect dogs are welcome on their patio.

This place seems to have a couple bad reviews here and there. This place was just fine on a Friday afternoon at lunch time (along with a crowd of worker bee's getting their lunches)   Food was tasty, atmosphere was just fine (maybe a tad bit noisy) but overall a place to at least visit a couple times to get a good feel for it. A bit pricey for what you get. (Ordered a club sandwich and my girlfriend got a sandwich along with a pomegranate drink and a coffee iced drink she got) all for just under $30.
Extremely disappointed. Food was bland at best. Definitely not what I would consider "fine dining."  Dirty and disorganized. I will not eat here again.

Second time giving this place a shot. It has been a while and thought it might have gotten better. My bf and I ordered breakfast and it was even worse than before. Cold, flavorless and dry. We also ordered the lavender honey latte and it was so gross we could not drink either the hott or iced. Will not be coming back here ever again. Go down the street to LGO, much better food and coffee!!

Very cool style and decor.....but this place is depressing and the food is depressing. From the music to the staff, they all need an attitude adjustment. We ordered the banana pancakes, and they were absolutely terrible. They tasted like mushy oatmeal. The other orders at our table did not look appetizing. The salad looked wilted and the bread from the sandwich was stale. To add to it, there was a fly all around our table and on our food. My wife gave up on her food. Will not return.

Nice selection of sweets.   Had the maple scone, mixed berry pop tart, and chocolate chip cookies.   Good stuff.    They serve Mama's cold brew.  I ordered one and got black, my friend ordered one and got vanilla?  Strange thing is they never asked what kind we wanted.  Coffee was good though.    Breakfast was pretty good - although a bit simple with the fruit being served in a plastic cup. Next time I'll probably stick with the sweets and coffee.  Double up on the scones.

Another fast-casual restaurant choice now open in my 'hood... hooray!  Chestnut Fine Foods & Provisions has actually been open just over a month to date, but I waited a couple of weeks to check it out... and while I've been in only a few times so far, I will definitely be returning... and likely soon.  They carry Cartel coffee and MJ bread, and Camelback Flower Shop is conveniently located in the same building.  During my visits, I sampled the Lobster Cobb Salad, the Bruce Lee, a blueberry muffin, and the Apple Apple (apple and pineapple juice).  Additional Pros: *clean and bright ambiance with yellows and whites, flowers, and more *free wifi *friendly staff *kids area with a chalkboard, table, markers and paper + a great kids menu for both breakfast and dinner *a spacious outdoor dining area *a variety of options on the menu from fresh squeezed juices and pastries, sandwiches and salads *open daily 7am -7pm *spacious and clean restrooms  Things to work on / keep in mind: -they were out of "It's Not Easy Being Green," the special kids' juice that I wanted to order for my son when I was there -it's kind of funky with parking unless you're heading south on 44th street and pull into their entrance prior to hitting Camelback -- when I go, I am usually heading west on Camelback and end up having to park at the office complex next door -- on their website, it says they have complimentary valet though! -the menu is diverse but kind of limited; they do not carry omelettes (egg whites or otherwise); I'm hoping they change this in the future!  Whether you head in for a cup of coffee or juice, a pastry, or a more substantial meal, and no matter if you're solo or meeting a friend or dining with a group, Chestnut is a comfortable new addition to the 'hood.

The Sandi sandwich was very tasty, next time I'll skip the aioli though. I opted for the roasted turkey as my protein and asked for raw jalapeños on the side, great way to give it a kick! My son had the Lil Lumberjack and it was a good sized portion. His apple carrot juice was delicious and my coffee was awesome as well. I'll definitely be back.  Oh, one last thing, the peanut butter gluten free cookie was amazzzzing! Eaten with a hot cup of coffee, is heaven! :D

We landed here after planning on eating elsewhere. It's a nice place, just not great.  The folks were nice and even brought our table a couple of cookies to share.  The food ranged from blah to pretty good.  One of our party actually sent something back.  I had the braised short rib hash (chalkboard special) and the eggs were over well but the dish had a nice flavor.  I tried a quinoa dish and was glad I had not ordered it,

For March's Breakfast Club UYE after a little set back we walked our way to Chestnut, yep it was a brisk early morning walk to breakfast, it wasn't in the plan, but that's how it unfolded.  I have to say Chestnut is a cute shop, I like the open feel of it, and the staff is real friendly and helpful. And they make a great tasting Mocha!   I went with the weekend special, it was the short rib hash with 2 over easy eggs. In theory this dish would have rocked, but in reality it was a texture thing that was a little off.  The onions were twice the size of the potatoes, the meat of the short rib looked like it was just ripped of the bone and tossed in with potatoes, just all chucky, I guess I like my hash to be equal in size haha. The flavoring was great though, so I got over the size textures sort of quickly.  Over all Chestnut is a cute little place and glad I finally got to try them out

I loveeeeee this place .. amazing music .. service (Kirsten) and food. I'm huge on vibe and this had it all.  Not only that but it's so hard finding good vegan ramen and this place NAILED it .. my 9/o son loves it too

One of my fav. Little cafes in the biltmore area! I love the environment. Staff is helpful and friendly and I come here a lot to pick up my fav. Mama's cold brew. Recommend the Bim Bim bap bowl, sandwiches and their yogurt is to die for! I would totally recommend anyone to come grab a bite for brunch, lunch or just to grab a good coffee and tasty pastry from!

Love coming here for the fun Mimosas on Sundays.  It's super cute with a little fun straw and tastes just right.  Kirsten the owner is so nice too.  They have a cute little store in the back with all these kitschy finds, I felt like I was shopping at my great Aunt's house or something.  I loved all the knick knacks here.  The ricotta waffe was delicious too.  It was raining outside, cozy at Chestnut, and just the pefect Sunday to spend at my new favorite restaurant.

The food here is decent. I was bummed that they didn't have their signature cream with the momma's cold brew coffee today. It was a Sunday, figured if they had it available any day, Sunday would be it. The service is always spotty. They gave bacon instead of toast with our eggs. And one of the servers replied "It's self service" when my dad asked for some Tobasco. As if it would have killed him to just get the damn bottle.

On our departure from Phoenix to the Grand Canyon, we wanted to have a good breakfast.  Since it was Easter weekend, all surrounding restaurants were busy.  So, we Yelped and found CHESTNUT!!  The comfortable/relaxing ambiance, service, food and coffee were excellent.  If you do stop in for breakfast, you must try their lemon ricotta waffles - - to die for!!

Have tried going to this place 2 different times for ramen. First time I was informed that they only sell Ramen Thursday through Sunday. Second time I show up at 8:30pm and they closed early. They actually had the host walk out and tell us that they have already put everything away && can't serve us. Maybe they should take down there open sign or changed their hours on the Internet that say they're open until 9 PM. They obviously do NOT have good management && I will NEVER come back.
Menu is pretty limited but it's a cute little place for a quick bite and a coffee. The fruit and granola parfait is amazing.

Chestnut, you can thank Total Divas or The Bellas for having us come to the establishment today because well, I've watched the show and Chestnut has been featured on the show a few times. Honestly, I've already had my first choice for brunch this morning, but my first choice had a freaken line out the damn door so I had to find somewhere else to go. My second choice was closed on President's Day - ugh... So we started heading east on Camelback and I thought, "Why not Chestnut? Never been there before.."  The parking situation is a complete cluster... One way in and not an easy way in and one way out. The establishment is surrounded by professional/medical businesses and I can see how it can be a nuisance during peak hours.   When we finally make our way in, we are greeted to the front counter where you order and get a number (think Sauce). Luckily, I checked Yelp reviews to help me order and so we decided on the Sandi sandwich with prosciutto and the Lemon Ricotta waffle. I also got the lavender green tea for a drink.   We sat down and it was a beautiful day. Their patio looked out to the busy street on Camelback and they opened the doors so the fresh breeze came in. There aren't very many tables but it wasn't very busy, thank god, so we snagged a table with no problem.   We got our order rather quickly and the Sandi sandwich was ok. The lemon ricotta waffle was delicious and I highly recommend it. The tea was eh - I never was impressed with drinks that have "lavender" in it. Total of our bill: $20 with some change.   Overall, because there was no wait, our food came to us rather quickly, the day was beautiful, our bill wasn't expensive, and I'm in a good mood, I give them four stars. I wouldn't come here for lunch though on a weekday.

Was driving by at lunch time with a bit of time to kill. When I saw that they had juice I decided to stop in and try it.   I had a huge kale salad with pine nuts, romano cheese and dried currants. It was fresh and I thought it was a unique offering. Drank a cup of great coffee (from Cartel, I believe) and thoroughly enjoyed my Bruce Lee juice (carrot, ginger... Plus some other stuff).   Parking was no problem and they have a nice, albeit very noisy, patio seating area. Staff was prompt, knowledgable and courteous. Prices are in the higher end of the range for lunch, but really about the same as other restaurants of similar caliber.   I would definitely return and recommend to friends.
Yum yum yum! Lemon ricotta waffles and banana bread pancakes are delicious. Service was very polite and fast. Environment is very modern and shabby chic.

My first time here wasn't the best but the second time around made up for it. To start, the restaurant is such a nice place to have a good bite to eat. Their patio is huge! While the inside doesn't have much options besides the bar area.That's my only con for this place. As for the food I decided to go with the waffle sandwich and it was perfect! The potatoes on the side made for the perfect compliment! The service has always been great and I look forward to coming again and next time I'm definitely trying the juices!

It is wonderful going to a breakfast spot in Arcadia/Biltmore at 10:30a on a Sunday, and it is not chock full of diners.  I love that I can order my entire meal at the counter, while being dazzled by their selection of Tammy Coe pastries and various other home baked goods, such as the decadent Almond Croissant (of which our party had 3).  It is nice getting my daily juice fix with their "Green Market Goodness" with kale, cucumber, orange, lemon and olive oil and satisfying my sweet tooth with the Lemon Ricotta Waffles (honey ricotta cheese and blueberry compote).  My favorite savory selection here is the "Sandi" with gruyere, arugula, truffle aoli, egg, and choice of meat.  The wide open space that lets in the natural light on all sides, the centralized pastry bar, the flower shop in the corner, the coffee and juice bar by the door, the kids corner where your little ones can entertain themselves while you order another Cartel coffee,  the outdoor seating, the low level of noise generated by other customers, the cool beats heard overhead, I thoroughly enjoy this spot for breakfast.

I had high hopes for this new eatery. Those hopes were dashed today. First, the parking lot and parking are a pain in the butt. I struggled through that because I wanted to try the place.  The menu is pretty lean, but decent options.  You order and then go sit and wait for your food to be delivered to your table.  Food came out quickly.  I had their version of a club sandwich.  The turkey abs bacon were good.  The bread was a bird's delight, but too seedy for me. The tomatoes were blah.  It was served with house made sweet potato chips.  They were oily and most were not crisp.  I also received a small cup of cut cucumber in vinegar.  Hmm?  Traffic noise is intense and not a place you want to have a semi private conversion as you have to talk loudly to hear each other.  In fact, I thought about typing this in all caps so you could hear me over the traffic roar.   All in all, I would suggest going to one of the other nearby eateries. There are many options that have better food, easy access and a pleasant atmosphere.

First, let me say that the SERVICE was wonderful.   Here's what not:  1)  The french toast were awful and shoggy 2)  Hot coffee and cap were not hot enough and had a bit of sourness  The worst possible thing about Chestnut is the HUGE AMOUNT OF PLASTIC WASTE they create by service butter in tiny plastic contains, fruits and sides were served in plastic container, syrups, water, etc, etc.  An average table of 4 would have about 14-20 plastic items!!!

Just went here to try Mama's Cold brew coffee. No prices listed but menu said cold brew was $2.50 for a large. My total for a large was $8.12!!! All I got was a large mama' scold brew. Cashier said a regular is $5 and the large is $8. That is the most expensive and most ridiculous price for coffee I have ever heard! I frequent other places for coffee a lot and an used to paying up to $5 for a large coffee, but $8 seems like a ridiculous price!! Will never go back again!

Wow!  Local moms you have to get here ASAP!  The food offerings look amazing. I saw some grab and go that needs to be in my fridge- now.   However, I only came in for a quick cup of coffee. The cashier encouraged me to try the lavender infused honey latte. Amazing. Great recommendation.   Both the owners were in there- wow!  What inspiring, kind and fantastic women.   Give this place a try!
Best green eggs and ham (pesto and prosciutto) I have ever tasted. It was a perfect breakfast to end my work trip to Arizona. Staff was amazing. Love the vibe.

Delicious! I had the lemon blueberry and ricotta waffles. I was skeptical at first but it exceeded my expectations. It was really a wonderful blend of flavors! I like how you just go up and order and they bring over your food. You don't have to wait for a waitress to take your order and that is the kind of place I like!

Such an adorable restaurant and what a bonus- the food is fantastic!!!  I love the spin the owners took on this menu; there is a little bit of everything for any type of eater.  I personally fell in love with two things my first time there and I cannot get enough of them, the Lobster Roll and the Bonh Mi.  One would more than likely picture a Lobster Roll in Scottsdale as some canned lobster with mayo on a sub, but not here!!  Chestnut served it with huge chunks of fresh lobster with an amazing sauce that has a bit of kick to it. (PS- I would kill for the recipe)! The Bonh Mi is something that I have never had anywhere.  My husband has been to Asia multiple times though so he was excited to try.  When I took a bite of his I was in heaven!  The chicken mixed with the pickled onions, cilantro and spicy mayo was such a great combo.  My husband said it compared to what he has had overseas.  Staff is kind and helpful.  Restaurant super clean and the decor is cool modern with a rustic twist.  Can't wait to return

I would give the food 5 stars, but the service just isn't up to speed yet.  It just opened this week and I think they are still working out the kinks, but the food is delicious...  Hands down probably the best oatmeal I have ever had.    The restaurant itself is decorated brilliantly and gives off the hip vibe that the Arcadia residents drool over.  Given that the intersection at 44th St. and Camelback is one of the most trafficked areas in Phoenix I think this place has a good shot at doing well.    I will stop back by and review my post after the next experience.

I wish I had looked at Yelp before coming here. But I can say - I understand why this is 3 stars.   We walked in to and almost empty resto after first trying to get into a packed Flour Child. We thought we found a hidden jewel.  Waiting in the single register line for nearly 20 minutes behind 4 other people (one single + 1 group of 3) was ridiculous.  We tried to give benefit of the doubt - thinking our fellow diners were (perhaps) being difficult. Nope!  The wait sucked.  Pricing was high.  Food was good.   So, my summary, I won't be back. With so many other faster, better fast casual restos in Arcadia (paradise bakery, wildflower, anything at the Biltmore) this place has got to pick up it's game or it will be just another short-lived place that changes names 1,000 times. But without the endearing "you know the old Chestnut."

UPDATE!  Back in town and could not wait to go back to Chestnut. Same inviting atmosphere and wonderful menu. This time had the brussel sprout salad - LOVED IT - if you are a sprout eater, get this! It is as advertised. All brussels and no filler, which you find with so many brussel salads and always disappoints. Not at Chestnut!!   Awesome on a plate. Couldn't wait to dig in before taking the photo shared here. Yum!    FIRST REVIEW First, the space - so inviting, warm and full of charm.  Second, the service - happy staff, very helpful in answering our many questions, and anxious to hear our feedback.  Third, the food - Fantastically delicious! We had the ricotta waffles, chicken and waffles and the pop tart. Plus amazing and fresh grapefruit juice. Would have all of it again but really can't wait to try something new next time.

I stumbled upon this due my dentists office being rt next door. It's super cute inside. I ordered an egg sandwich since there weren't any vegetarian/vegan "meats" They did offer me to sub another egg, which I was totally fine with. I ordered to go. When I got the sandwich the bun was pretty much a seedless hamburger bun. Heavy and not breakfasty at all. The sandwich seemed thrown in there and a mess. One egg wasn't in the sandwich, it had adhered to the paper, then busted as I tried to load it on the bun. The eggs were watery and undercooked. There was mayo as a sauce--MEH! Good amount of spinach and tomatoes though. Sandwich was lackluster at best. Would not order this sandwich again. The blueberry pop tarts looked delicious!!

First off the parking lot was harder the heck to get into just an FYI but besides that I love the set up of this place. It's very open with a square bar in the middle. It's a great lunch place.   The menu was a not my favorite and they stopped serving breakfast after 11 so that was a bit annoying but what won me over was the sandwich I ordered. "Short rib manwich". It was simple and amazing. It came with great sweet potato chips that I couldn't stop eating. It was 11 bucks but I would over it every time.

If you love fabulous coffee but don't mind that the tables and floors are dirty from what looks like 3 meals before yours this will be your spot. I thought I could handle it till I got syrup on my LV. My husband tried to clean our table- :(

If you are trying to get a quick morning bite, go somewhere else. When we arrived there was a line to order and it took about 15 mins. When we finally ordered we sat down and about 40 mins later our food comes out cold. I definitely would not recommend unless you dont mind waiting for cold food.
Great breakfast place with great food, drinks, service, and atmosphere! My favorite is the lemon ricotta waffles and their smoothies are tasty too!

I have been to Chestnut many times as a breakfast patron--my kids love the S'mores Galore pancakes, the coffee is excellent, and I have tried many things--their homemade granola is always good--last time I ate there I had the chia pudding with granola on top--yum! Many people have complained on here about the service, but I have always had good service. In the mornings this is a counter service place--so you place your order at the counter and then it arrives at your table--I don't expect the same sort of service from counter restaurants as from table-service restaurants, so I think there is an issue with expectations from some patrons.  Last night, we tried out Water Chestnut--Thurs-Sat nights from 5pm to close. Both my girls got the Kid's Ramen bowls (very reasonably priced), and I had the Ramen--we all really enjoyed it. The BBQ pork was excellent, my nori, veggies, fish cake were perfect. The service was great--they left a little carafe of water at the table which I really appreciated. For dessert, we had matcha green tea ice cream (from Sweet Republic!!--another of my favorites) with a little sesame bun on the side that was really great. We will definitely come back for more ramen.

Like others have said - this place has potential, it isn't what it could be. I love the vibe here, good music and decor. I thought this was a sit down restaurant for some reason but it's more set up like a Panera or Flower Child were you order and take a number to a table. That's fine, but why do they only have one cash register/cashier during brunch hours? Kind of a wonky way to run a restaurant that would obviously be busy on a weekend morning. I ordered, the hipster staff was friendly, food came out pretty quickly. It was yummy, simple food. This isn't the kind of brunch where you walk away hating yourself and clutching a food baby - it was filling and healthy in a way that made me feel good about myself and life choices in general. Probably because my eggs were topped with kale and salmon, not oozing with cheese. The plate was good in general except for the toast, which was.. Stale? I think? I couldn't cut it with my knife, whatever that means. Less carbs I guess. The other drawback was the price; I'd been warned by Yelpers beforehand so it wasn't a totally shock when I paid $15 for my breakfast and coffee. For that kind of price I would expect better quality things like bread and a less weird cashier set up. I'll come back, there are other things on the menu I'd like to try, but it'll have to be close to payday.
Hey! This place is awesome! Great atmosphere and food is awesome. The mule drink is right on. Keep up the good work guys!
This will always be one of my favorite places to go. They're in a great location, have amazing brunch dishes, delicious ramen and sweets galore.

Cute place, food mediocre at best. Decided to check it out when I was on my way to LGO. Got the prosciutto & Brie sandwich which was only prosciutto and Brie and bread. No figs, balsamic, Dijon or anything! First time ever I have not enjoyed a sandwich with prosciutto on it.  Fresh sweet potato chips were good, but I was really hungry. :(.   Btw, parking in this center is terrible so carpool if you must come here but I wouldn't suggest it.
Definitely not worth the price. Too many other good choices try the new Fox place across the street. MUCH better than Chestnut. Sorry to say

I met a friend here for lunch one day.  It is cutely decorated and the food was good.  But we waited a VERY long time for our food and there were only a few folks in the place!  We had to ask a few times where our food was.  Not to mention it was extremely difficult to find a clean table...the place was filthy.  We were both underwhelmed by our experience here.  I won't be back.
Place was very messy and unorganized. Beside the self serve being very inconvenient (even the water!) tables were not cleaned up, & they weren't even busy!!   Food was pretty good though

Super cute cafe-style restaurant that is great for brunch! I got the Lemon Ricotta Waffles, and they were delicious! My friend got the Ultimate Grilled Cheese Sandwich, which comes with sweet potato chips, and really enjoyed her food too. My only complaint is that my meal arrived about 10 minutes after hers, so we couldn't start eating together. Next time I might try a sandwich.

This place is inconsistent. The first time I came here on a weekday and had the breakfast Bibimbap and my wife had the Ricotta Waffles, and and it was good. Today (Sunday) I ordered the same dish and the poached eggs were hard making the entire dish dry. The coffee was overly bitter with a layer of coffee grounds. My mother's pancakes were undercooked and partially raw. I'm willing to give this place one more try on a weekday, but I'm probably never coming back on a weekend. They seemed a bit overwhelmed, and the place was not even full.

An event I went to had some small offerings catered by Chestnut a while back and they were great. After looking online for where to get Mama's Cold Brew on a Sunday we made the trip to Chestnut and we won't be returning.   To start the line to order was out the door but only 5 tables or so were occupied. The cashier looked frustrated and another gentleman came and took over. The line was moving slowly but moving. We ordered 2 cold brew coffees, a scramble plate, a soup, and a cookie. We were informed by the gentleman that Mama's creamer is 1.50 extra each coffee (no problem), but cold brew coffee refills are free (great). He poured quite a bit of creamer in (a little much) but being we could get coffee refills I figured I would drink some down and make room for coffee.  Maybe we ordered the wrong thing but our food was underwhelming with the exception of the cookie. We sat on the patio and despite 3 bus boys running around tables were still dirty with dishes.   On our way out I walked up to the girl behind the bar but not the cashier and asked for a coffee refill.There was still a line and I was trying to avoid stepping back into it. We had barely drank any it was very sweet with the excess creamer. She said she was new and unsure. I told her what the cashier had told me and she complied. The cashier then stops her and tells her we have to be charged. My husband said "for what"? We walked to a different cashier so that he could charge us for...a splash of coffee? To which my husband said " I will pay you but please tell me what I am paying for." After an explanation we were allowed to leave.    Mama's Cold Brew was on sale for take home, I really wanted to buy some but did not due to line and just wanting to get the heck out of there.   1 star for the cookie, 1 because we didn't hate the place

My over medium eggs came out over easy and cold with a side of cold toast that wasn't really even toasted. Really?  I am certainly dubious about the other featured items. How hard can it be to get eggs and toast even close to being ok? They plate didn't even begin to look appetizing.   Well, were they really busy?  Nope. Not even. AND as I try to relax the staff is pulling wrapped silverware from my table to put on a just cleared table next to me, poured someone's left over water in the plant on my table, and glassware and pans crash and break all around me.  Super noisey. Really unprofessional. Anything but a nice simple relaxing Sunday morning breakfast. Ugh!  The desserts look amazing (actually they are I've been here before) but my daughter will have to twist my arm to come back here!

First time we found this place it was great  as was the second time when we came for ramen noodles but then we showed up today for a late breakfast and was very disappointed.  The oatmeal which has always been yummy was dry and yucky and the french toast was soggy in the middle and had no taste. Not sure what happened but noticed the prices did increase from the first time to this time and the food has suffered.  Hoping they get things together for the better soon
Place is beyond amazing, I can't understand how the Yelp reviews aren't better. Service , food , ambience . Grab a muffin or the bibimbap bowl, both very good

Chestnut hosted an event for my niece this past weekend and I can't rave enough about the level of service provided. Additionally our guests ranted about the food particularly the fried Brussels sprouts and the crispy chicken.   Kirsten once again was a saint and worked with all the dietary requirements of our guests. I would recommend chestnut for catering without hesitTion and will continue to use them for catering needs.

A cute little industrial brunch spot with healthy breakfast and lunch options   Service is okay The girl at the front was very brief and didn't really explain how ordering/seating/beverages worked but we figured it out The menu is on your immediate right when you walk in and there are paper menus on the counter (tip) Complimentary water on the SW side of the counter-bar Our server was very nice  Today I had the egg salad sanny and it came with chips and pickled cucumbers  It was a pretty decent meal I thought I would expect more for the price but I guess it was the area  Also, there is a little kid section Don't get me wrong, I love kids But this restaurant doesn't seem very kid-friendly... Or at least that's what I think with the heavy steel chairs with that flooring... There were many children there this morning and aside from the screaming and yelling... The kids were rearranging furniture and such... My main concern being the chairs and tables... Not very kid-safe...  I am not sure how I feel about this place, it's cute, perhaps I will give it another go soon...   Stay tuned Yelp

I had the opportunity to eat at Chestnut a few times before working here. and the food is different but it's so delicious! my favorites are the bibimbap bowl, lemon ricotta waffles, and the quinoa salad with chicken. the food is amazing and I always noticed how attentive the staff was. even when they were bombarded with a rush of customers, they always had everything out in a timely manner. and working here has shown me the hard work that goes into this job. the staff is such an awesome group of people. the owner is kind and always wants the best for the customer. so continue to show your support for the local movement and come visit us!

This place has rude staff that doesn't give a darn and the experience went with that theme.  The table was dirty as was the floor. Our lobster roll was overcooked, fishy and chewy.  The sweet potato chips were pretty decent.  We also ordered a brussel sprout salad and it was as if the cook dumped shredded brussel spouts with nothing done to them on a plate.  The owner or chef or anyone working there must not have ever tried this boring disaster of a salad.  We saw a few of them remain uneaten as well as ours.  The thing is you would think that the bus boy/diswasher  might let the cook know...but the fact is no one at this place cares.  At the end were were going to get some baked goods and the line was long...we feel bad for those who ate there...but we were spared a weak dessert experience I'm sure.

Stopped in for breakfast on a Saturday morning. It wasn't too busy so we could order quickly. Chose the smoked salmon plate and the baked oatmeal. Both were good but the salmon needed more seasoning. The oatmeal was really rich and we couldn't finish it but was quite flavorful. Bought the butterscotch roll to go - really good! The service was good but nothing special. We'll be back...worthwhile spot to go to on a quiet weekend.

Ordered some Brunch to go. Went with some Green Eggs and Ham and a small Grapefruit/Orange/Carrot Juice. They do a great job with their marketing and design but the food is just simply not up to par. The ingredients are quality; arrangement is mediocre. The green eggs and ham is an open faced sandwich with prosciutto, arugula, a poached egg smothered with pesto on top. The Prosciutto was overwhelming and was the only thing you could really taste. I am a huge fan of eggs Benedict and figured that this meal would be like eggs Benedict sub Benedict sauce for pesto... Boy was I wrong. Poached eggs are usually soft but this one was a little overcooked. I would've also chosen a different bread, maybe something with more of a texture or crunch. The pesto was super oily and did not add anything new except what tasted like an excess of sodium when combined with the prosciutto. Overall, I'm highly disappointed by the lack of flavor profile...this could have been so good.

I would give this place zero out of five stars. The service was pathetic!!! The food was cold and stale. They even forgot my order and I had to go and remind them!!! We had to wait on the line to order our food and it took forever. The server only came once and did not ask for any salt or ketchups. When the food came, it was cold and for the price it was- not at all worth. The coffee looked like it was sitting on the pot for hours and no body made a fresh batch. I paid 2 bucks for that yucky coffee and they charged 3 bucks for a can of soda to my friend!! It was my first and of course this will be my last. It was a horrible experience and such a rip off place to be!!!

What a disappointment.   Now, I held off writing a review after a horrible first experience thinking that Chestnut had potential.   First of all, they really have the ordering system wrong. You walk in and have to stand in line while they have one cash register for taking orders. Personally, I love places where I can pay and take my number to a table. There is really nothing more annoying than waiting for a server to bring you your bill so you can leave, although, Chestnut needs to speed up this process. There is no reason why I should have to stand in line for over 15 minutes when only 3 people are ahead of me in line.   I went in today with a broken leg. So clearly after standing at the door on crutches for 15 minutes I was already a little irritated and ready to sit down. The girl who took my order, just rude. You could tell she didn't want to be there and did not want to help me.   We ordered took our number and sat down. I'm still unclear if they bring the drinks to your table or if you're suppose to pick them up. After sitting at our table for another 10 minutes with no one bringing us waters or silverware my boyfriend went up to the coffee counter. There he found my drink and while he was gone an employee brought me his drink. I asked him for waters and he told me I had to get them myself. I explained and showed him I was on crutches and had a broken leg and could not carry them and kindly asked him to bring me one. He scoffed and said alright, the waters never came.   I ordered a Lavender-Honey Latte. Wow....that was the worst coffee drink I've ever had. I asked the girl if I could get something else because it was that terrible. I've never sent back a coffee drink until today. Steer clear of this drink. She brought me a sugar-free vanilla latte with almond milk. It was so-so but not worth $6.   For breakfast I ordered the Bibimbay Bowl which is two poached eggs on a bed of steamed kale, quiona and siracha. I don't know how they managed it, but once again another terrible dish. It was down right disgusting. Salty, the kale wasn't cooked enough and I don't know what seasoning was used but it was awful. After sending back my coffee, which didn't come out until after my food arrived, I wasn't even going to say anything.   After two terrible experiences at this restaurant, I will be eating breakfast at any other restaurant. It's safe to say that Chestnut is possibly the WORST RESTAURANT IN PHOENIX.

Absolutely delicious. Split the breakfast hash with my mom this morning. It was on special for $7. Also had a small caramel latte. Both were to delicious. The menu was so diverse and had so many things to chose from on top of the amazing pastry selection. Highly recommend

I had the pancakes with 2 eggs over easy and my wife had the lobster salad.  Both were excellent and came out quickly and looking delicious.  The patio is nice but the seating inside is comfortable.  Even has a community table that gave the place a homey feeling.  We can only give this place our highest compliment, "We will be back."

Stopped in yesterday to grab breakfast after I worked all night. We came here on the recommendation of a friend. The experience was awful. We picked out and ordered our meals along with a large latte. While waiting we wondered through this little gift shop area they have of cute antiques and decorating things, it really is super cute. We grabbed seats on the outdoor patio and waited for our food and coffee. The young man who took our order came out and said their espresso machine wasn't working and asked what else I'd want to drink. Ok things happen however I think he should've come out refund in hand and then offered a complimentary drink of my choice. I don't drink regular drip coffee as it upsets my stomach so I was left without an option. Our food came out and the first thing I noticed was my husbands hash didn't look very appealing, the meat to me almost had a greenish color to it. He said the meat was rubbery, the eggs were sunny side up not over easy and the dish itself was full of grease at the bottom. I ordered the lemon ricotta waffles and they were so overcooked you couldn't even taste the lemon over the burnt taste. I tried to eat them because I hadn't eaten all night but they weren't very appetizing so I had to stop. I definitely won't be back because not one thing about the whole experience was right, meals we couldn't eat and a coffee we never got. It was so disappointing. We did get a full refund. It's really unfortunate because the inside is so cute and they've got great patio seating. We really loved the space.

How did I not know about this place? An artist friend suggested it as a place to meet for our periodic "catch-up" brunches. Since she has never steered me down the wrong path before, I accepted. It is easy to find and on the weekend there is plenty of parking. Great location, but during the week you may have trouble parking at busy times. Plan ahead. Worth the effort.  The menu is extensive and varied . . . in other words, I had trouble making up my mind. Everything sounded yummy. Once that was settled and we sat down for our catch-up time, I truly enjoyed the atmosphere and the items I had selected: Small G.O.C., 1/2 fruit salad & a mixed berry scone.   There is a small "antique" shop where you can purchase unique kitchen items. There is a guest table right in the center where you can submerse you & friends in another era, but with all the good treats that Chestnut has to offer.   A must return. I want to try other items on the menu. Recommended: The lobster salad. OMGoodness! I can hardly wait.
Sooo expensive and not good!  Met a customer at Chestnut this am for my first time in. Two iced coffees and 3 (mini muffin sized) COLD frittatas and a $26 tab?!?!  Needless to say, I won't be back.

I came here with a big group of us for lunch and was super excited. This place is close and pretty fast. I found the atmosphere to be really hip and adorable. I'm pretty particular on my reviews, so I don't give anyone above a 3 if I'm not extremely impressed by their food. I got the chicken salad sandwich with chips on the side. It was a very average meal and I felt like I was the happiest one at our table with my meal. The plus side is the chocolate chip cookies are really good! Stop by to have a treat, but nothing more?

We came here for their new dinner concept Water Chestnut. We really enjoyed the food!  Here's what we had:  Cocktail: Tiger Mom Appetizer: Bao Steamed Bun with Short Rib  Ramen: with bbq pork, sweet corn, spinach, cabbage    All the food was very tasty and the cocktail, Tiger Mom, was AMAZING! Do yourself a favor and order this delicious frozen mango/coconut concoction!  I would come back just to order this drink.   I'm taking off 1 star because the service was a little spotty...had to get up and ask for my drink and it didn't come until the middle of my entree. BUT we will be back for the food!

I had the bibimbap bowl and it was delicious! Eggs were poached just right. My husband got the banana protein pancakes and they were super tasty! Only negative is that the utensils are collectively held in mason jars but it seems like they are always running low. Just give me utensils with you bring my food so I can chow down :)!
Best gluten free pancakes ever! Served with glazed bacon yum!!!! Service is excellent and everything coming out if the kitchen looked fantastic!

The owners obviously gave significant thought to the concept and design;  unfortunately the food fails to reflect the necessary level of excellence required to compete in this wonderful neighborhood bastion of great restaurants that has been developing in recent years.  The grilled cheese was on two thick slices of tasteless bread and the cheese and tomatoes were flat.  Most importantly, the grilled cheese was not really even grilled.  A good grilled cheese should be beautifully golden and melty and crispy;  but this was not the case here, instead it was pasty and lacked flavor.  The quinoa salad had very little quinoa;  it would be better characterized as an arugula salad with quinoa.  A true quinoa salad is a plate of quinoa with mixed dried fruit.  We ate a bite or two and left.  No one noticed our dissatisfaction and seemed like a bunch of young servers running around like chickens without heads and no front of the house management.  Very disappointing and will be surprised if this place makes it with a gem like The Henry, which recently opened across the street.

I want to give this place five stars...  The food is really, really good. Their kale salad is amazing. The pastries are good, especially the pecan bar and cookies (more so than the muffins and scones). The decor is really nice; it feels light, airy, and casual. They even have a little kids' corner. They have healthy and delicious options, and great kids' options too.  The two reasons I can't give it five stars are easy to fix: 1) There is no decaf espresso, which is SO weird and kind of makes it a deal breaker for me as a coffee/morning place. 2) They moved the kid area over by the register where there are no normal tables, so you can't sit near your kids while they play. There is one high-top table, but that doesn't work if you have a baby in a high chair, or if you have to get down to discipline/help your kids, and obviously kids can't sit there. Very strange.

Not impressed. 2nd visit and service not great or friendly. Could be because both times I cam in near 2which is close to 3, their closing time.   All Tables were dirty and was not busy so not sure why they couldn't have been wiped off The chopped salad and and famous "Buddy" sandwich we had were good but nothing so special that I would return to order.     The best part -- and I really did appreciate is that the coffee is out for free refills and is decent coffee.  Wish they offered stevia instead of Splenda.    With so many "like" places nearby, this one needs to make some changes to stand apart.

Came here for Sunday brunch and ordered the lemon ricotta waffle, shortrib manwich and ultimate grilled cheese.  Waffle was spot on.  Slightly crunchy on the outside while moist on the inside with blueberries baked into the waffle and on top with the lemon ricotta cheese topping.  Grilled cheese had cheese both on the outside as well as in between bread slices.  I didn't try the shortrib but heard no complaints.  Coffee is good too and had self serve refills.   Not our first time here (although it has been a while). We'll be back.
Good food but the most uncomfortable seating ever... Why does industrial have to mean uncomfortable?

Cool concept. Good service. Order at the counter, seat yourself with a number and they delivery your food. The food was okay, nothing to write home about. Tried the cinnamon French toast. Why spend $9 on French toast (no sides) and then serve it with regular syrup. Drives me nuts that the "gourmet" pancakes/French toast that you pay about $10 for, for them alone and they don't serve REAL maple syrup. Almost ruins the whole breakfast.
I won't be going back. The food was ok and over priced. Oh and the coffee Tastes like its burnt.

Have to say my first experience was not a great one of Chestnut. Came here for two things, grab a latte and Camelback Flower Shop. One, the flower shop was closed, not sure that makes any sense on a weekend. I love the Camelback Flower Shop, but they really should be open on Sundays at Chestnut. Second, and this is my reason for the 2 stars, the service is horrible here. With only 2 of us in line how can ordering and receiving a latte take 20 minutes. The staff runs around like they're lost and there is no communication. Employees would rather talk to each other than acknowledge they have a customer waiting to order. I really don't think I will ever go here again. Total letdown, I would much rather just go to the Camelback Flower Shop and Cartel Coffee.

Mimosas are amazing. Made with fresh orange juice. The food is fresh and light. Great place to grab a quick healthy meal that will keep you going and not bog you down.   Take a break and grab somw.good food.   And I could eat the chocolate chip cookies all day.  #chestnutvip
Delicious food, friendly service and a great patio! The cappuccino is delish and the ultimate grilled cheese is awesome

Chestnut just doesn't care. Being the new kid on the block and set in a gorgeous location, Chestnut doesn't have to work hard. And it shows.  My friend and I were excited to go to the hot new spot and left super disappointed. Read about our ordeal here: http://www.nickialanoche.com/2014/01/30/do-not-go-to-chestnut-fine-foods-and-provisions-in-phoenix/
Great food in a bright and friendly environment. Eat inside, outside, or takeaway. EXCELLENT!

This place is conveniently located and has a nice, modern decor, one which unfortunately allows sound to thunder through the room. The food can be quite good. Unfortunately it can also be quite mediocre. The pastry is particularly strong, and this is a great place to drop in and have a cup of coffee and a piece of cake. That is especially true if there isn't some inconsiderate lout lolling about talking incessantly on his phone. The last time I was there, that's what happened and nobody would take responsibility for asking him to behave appropriately, not even when he put his feet up on a table. Now back to the mediocre food. I had a nice fruit plate. The fruit was reasonably fresh perhaps a little under-ripened and the honeyed walnuts, while few, were good. My wife had the short ribs, on a plate rather than in a sandwich. They were dry to the point of limited edibility. The sweet potato chips served with her meal were, however, quite good. However, bad protein equals bad review. So, would I go back? Yes. The place is right near my physician's office and I usually eat breakfast after my visit so blood can be drawn. I certainly don't want to then drive looking for something to eat. However, I don't see returning for lunch and I doubt my wife would be willing to even if I wished.

I have been here for breakfast a few times and have always really enjoyed it! They have delicious coffee, teas and some grab and go matcha that I am obsessed with. As well as the most beautiful fresh pastry section every day! Their home made pop tarts get me every time. Today I went for lunch and was equally impressed. I had the roasted vegetable and faro salad with chicken. It was really good! You order, pay, then sit down and wait for your food to be brought to your table, making it a very convenient get in get out place to eat. Very cute atmosphere inside with a tiny bit of specialty retail. Breakfast/lunch Phoenix staple!

Well decorated. Located on the corner of camelback and 44th st.  We came here for breakfast on a Sunday. Our order included the green eggs and ham, ricotta and blueberry waffles, and the scramble (traditional 2 egg breakfast).   The atmosphere is casual, open, and well lit. They have an antique shop and an area for kids to play all within the restaurant. Succulents adorn most tables and some seating may be reserved.   Our drinks were delivered quickly to our table which included an iced coffee and the Julius. The Julius is a healthier version of what you would traditionally expect. I enjoyed it quite a bit! The iced coffee was supposed to have extra ice, the ice amount was a little less than expected.   The green eggs and ham included a poached egg, with arugula, pesto, and prosciutto on top a very yummy bun. 10 out of 10 for flavor, texture, and heat. I was definitely happy with this choice.   The waffles that came to the table, we were told, may have been sitting out for a bit, so they replaced them with a new order without us asking. The difference really was the temperature. I actually didn't notice until they brought the second plate. (Much appreciated!) The honey and ricotta add a unique twist on blueberry waffles. I would order again.  The two egg breakfast, I'm told by my breakfast companion, was as good as eggs can be over hard. I had some of the bacon from this entree and it was very sticky and sweet to me. This bacon, while tasty, was not as crispy as I would have hoped.   Overall, I would visit again, and I'd love to try some of the other items on their menu. They have a matcha chai pudding and many pastries that looked beyond delicious.
Best chocolate chip cookies EVER!!! I can't help but stop for one....or a dozen whenever I'm near.

I was excited to check this out as a new nearby lunch place (close to work) and suggested we try it to my co-workers on Friday.   First drawback: the parking. Almost worse than LGO. And it's not even busy yet. Small lot that is hard to get to - being on the busy intersection.  Most of the open spots were reserved for other businesses so this will for sure be a drawback in the future.   Second: Menus weren't up and you didn't really know where to order.  We were given paper menus. Tried ordering an Arnold Palmer or Strawberry Lemonade and both were not available yet. ?? One of my co-workers tried to order one of the juice drinks at the top of the menu and they didn't have those yet either. Then another co-worker tried to order breakfast for lunch and again - they didn't do breakfast at lunch (but, like most places) did not have this indicated on their menu.   Two of us ordered the 5-spice Ban Mi sandwich, one got the egg salad and another the grilled cheese with bacon. I also had ordered a 1/2 order of fruit salad because it sounded different. Pretty disappointing. The ban mi sandwiches were tasty and large portions - but nothing that I think I will be craving anytime soon for $9. The co-worker who got the egg salad said it was just plain egg salad and didn't have any "tang" to the dressing that the menu indicated. Then my co-worker who got the grilled cheese said it was just okay but had a weird sweetness to it. And they forgot the bacon (which they promptly put on it when she let them know). My half fruit salad was pretty sad - the menu said it would have lime juice, creme freche (sp?)  and honey - all of which were completely missing.  And the fruit was un-flavorful white colored strawberries, small pieces of pineapple and blueberries. Thought about trying to get my money back but would have been too much of a hastle.   Also, watching the staff - one of my co-workers used to work at Sam Fox restaurants - she made the comment that they all seemed to be new to the food service industry. They definitely need more training.  Our conclusion: They weren't ready to open yet and needed to spend time "working out the kinks."    I might try it again in several months and if so I'll update my review. But, definitely wouldn't recommend spending your money here until they work out some issues!  Other notes: The design is very nice and the florist shop inside is amazing. But with its high price points and certain style I wonder how long it will last....   The two stars are for the decor/design, the yummy sweet potato chips and spicy pickled cucumbers that came with our sandwiches.

This is a classier neighborhood stop. Casual dining experience and great atmosphere. The menu is unique, haven't disliked anything yet. Be prepared to wait for a table to open up it gets busy during high volume hours and tables are first come first sit, self seating.   Recommended for a casual brunch or lunch or first meeting, it's not as formal as dinner out. They sell flowers but are by no means a flower shop. There is a cooler of flowers in the corner that's never full. All in all It's a great relaxing spot.

Chestnut is a wonderful, locally owned place to eat! I love sitting at the bar area either with a group or solo. It's a very warm, welcoming place. Their juices are delicious and the pastries are to die for- specifically the chocolate chip cookies!!!  There is a lot of integrity and hard work that goes into making this place a true local gem. I highly recommend it.

I came to the Chestnut after expecting to eat somewhere else with a group and having to relocate at the last minute. It was underwhelming to say the least. The restaurant is very cutely decorated and the counter service was friendly. I got the short rib hash and the husband got the pancakes. We both had coffee. The price was pretty expensive... about 30$. The pancakes were flavorless.... like chewing a pile of nothingness... I would not recommend them at all. The hash was alright... the veggies were fine, but the short rib was in huge chunks and wasn't very tender. The whole thing wasn't seasoned and needed sriracha to make it palatable. Even then, it was nothing special. We also got to try a couple cookies and a muffin, all of which were fine, but not great. Coffee was good. Overall, it was not a place I would go back to necessarily, but it gets points for decor and service....

Had the five spice banh mi today. My chicken was RAW.  I asked to speak to a manager and was refunded for that purchase, but he seemed unconcerned and neglected to offer anything else.  I love the coffee and the concept but the kitchen seriously needs work.

I've been to Chestnut several times now as I really love the location, quality ingredients and concept.  The decor in and out is cheery.  Seeing the patio diners from Camelback is really inviting.  They have a lot of nearby competition though and I think at the very least, they should adjust two things fast while they still have people's attention:  Flavor and prices.  The Sandi with turkey was very bland.  The english muffin wasn't toasted, and just lacked overall flavor.  It was also $10.  That's over $2 more than LGO's commuter which is delicious and flavorful.  Kale salad with chicken was a whopping $17!!  WHAT??  I made the mistake of not specifying small or large, and the cashier just selected large for me.  The price of adding chicken isn't listed on the menu, but it's $4.95!  I realize they have to pay the rent, but at these prices they won't be selling a lot of salads.  Other nearby competitors provide GREAT kale salads without protein for $8-9, add protein for $3.  The salad is also bland to boot.  They use qualilty ingredients here, I think the kitchen just needs work.  Baked oatmeal was delicious!  Grilled cheese was just ok, nothing special.  We asked for it on sourdough.  The cashier just took the order, but didn't bother to tell us they don't have sourdough.   Bacon is thick, maple glazed and delicous.  They don't have any low-carb breakfast menu options but recently had an egg white, turkey hash, spinich special.  I was excited they were testing out a low carb option. However, it was too "deconstructed."  Nothing pulled the dish together.  The turkey has was flavorful but dry. It was set atop scrambled egg whites that topped raw spinich.  I guess I expected the spinich to be steamed.  I felt like I was eating egg whites on a salad.  The bacon was the best part of this dish.  I haven't had a veggie juice there, but I'm glad they offer it.  Madison Improvement Club does fresh 16oz juice for $7, not $10.    They don't list menu prices of coffee, tea, muffins, or adding chicken to salads.  For lunch one day we ordered: soup, grilled cheese, kale salad with chicken, strawberry muffin, regular coffee, regular tea and it totaled $47 and this is a place without table service!  Our friends in the neighborhood share our sentiments about it being too pricey, and we are people that eat at quality establishments regularly.  I think they better adjust some prices if they want regular, repeat diners and referrals.  The service staff is very friendly, but I think the cashiers should be better trained to distill down on questions like, large or small, we don't carry sourdough, etc..  I was also there on a day when one of the owners snapped at her mother.  I was shocked, but I understand you might say things to your mother that you wouldn't say to other people.  But you are also not standing in your kitchen at home.  You are in the public eye.  Be nice!  This place could hit it out of the park with their location, healthy food philosophy and quality ingredients; but I think they better start putting out comment cards for people to fill out so they get a handle on what people really think before it's too late.  I already don't feel like going back because the food I've had isn't craveable, but I will because I hope they improve, I'll try other menu items, and I want them to survive after all the time, effort, and money they have invested.  I think they can make Fox envy their location, but they need to put out delicous dishes at competitive prices.

Disgusting. The chef should be ashamed. How that not only got past the chef and the server is beyond me. We just spent $40 on breakfast and left. Were now down the street getting something that doesn't look like it was pulled out of the garbage can last night.

I grabbed some to go today and thought it was horrible. 2 stars for the young lady who took my order, receipt says Kirsten. I ordered a side of sausage and a turkey club. The club was dry and the bread was the end of the loaf so the meat shot out every time I took a bite, (obviously after I added my own aioli). The sausage order hadn't come in yet (it was  1230 pm) so they substituted bacon , 2 pieces of bacon for 4 sausage links....okayyy) . Sweet potato chips were very good. I was looking forward to this place. Bummer.

what a lovely change from the mundane & arrogant competition in the area. Ps great repeat customer program (no punch card--what a concept!) & wonderful waitstaff-- actually nice & helpful!! Give it a try psps wonderful alternative to that other place...& great new 'pop up' concept on thrs thru sat featuring ramen & other Asian specialties. Nice to see something original!! PS3 water chestnut is great on thrs/fri/sat pm. Try it!
Delicious food! I got the sandy with turkey and hubby got the green ham and eggs. Both very good! Will definitely return!

I loved this place! Definitely a gem! Everything we had was great. I got the green tea, sweetened with lavender. Also got the blueberry pop tart to share with the table, amazing! All the food we ordered was great too. Super cute place. You go to the counter and order first, and they bring your order to you. Fresh ingredients and lots of flavor.

Not sure if it's new management or the team has just gotten too relaxed but the last two times I've visited have been disappointing. I have been working from Chestnut 2-3 times a month for at least a year. It's a beautiful build out and on nice days the windows are open to their patio making this a great spot to catch up on work. Last week when I worked there, I sat down at a table and there were papers crumpled up from straws and napkins. It'd be fine if it was post lunch or had been busy but it was only 7:30am and they had only been open for thirty minutes. That made me think they had not washed down the tables the night before. Then, to top it off, there was a hair in my granola bowl. Mistakes happen but to have two questionable cleanliness items happen in one visit, was gross and unfortunate. This morning I ate breakfast before going to avoid another hairy incident but was excited for a good hot cup of coffee and a productive morning. When I got to the counter, they told me they were out of regular coffee. I could only have decaf or an Americano. It was again 7am, so it wasn't like they had a mad rush and ran out of coffee. I opted for a cold brew and sat down. I spent 5 minutes trying to connect to their internet and finally asked if they were having issues. The employee said yes, they've had issues for a few days. All a girl needs is a clean place, with a hot cup of coffee and internet to work. Sad to see such a great spot become blah.

I'm loving the evening menu, Water Chestnut. The bao steamed bun with short ribs was the perfect appetizer. I picked the house ramen in shoyu broth with roast duck, soy egg, nori, and steamed cabbage for my ramen bowl. The ramen was perfectly cooked, and the broth was rich, and so flavorful. Everything else was just icing on the cake.  I ordered mango with sticky rice for my dessert, because C'mom, who could resist this deliciousness?? Not me!! I saw Fluff It Marshmallows Neapolitan pop on the counter at the register, and I couldn't resist buying one. It went really well with my coffee. Trust me when I say this combo was a  match made in heaven. The staff were super helpful and friendly. I love the open concept of this location. I'm glad I made the trip here. Bon Appetit everyone!!!

Let me start off by saying, the cookies and bran muffin I sampled were absolutely delicious!! Also, the service was fine - patient and kind - even amidst some VERY rude women with kids who sent the children's food back because the toast wasn't crispy enough..  That being said, I ordered the chopped salad with mixed greens and romaine I believe. The mixed greens were not just old, they were decomposing. Mushy and falling apart. Smelled terrible. This really irks me when you're paying $13 for a high-quality salad. I'm disappointed the chef didn't care enough to check what he puts on the plate. Otherwise, it would have been a great salad! I'm not that picky, but a lazy chef who doesn't care about food quality before the plate goes out is a bad sign.

The food was very good but front service needing work. Only one register and line was 6-8 people deep.  Took too long to order.  The girl at the register did not know about the food. She needs training on menu.

Have been driving by this place for quite a while and was curious how the restaurant was. Ate lunch there after church on a Sunday afternoon place was very busy. Very trendy and happening place with loud music.   The decor is very simple but quaint and not a very large dining area. The parking is a little awkward to get in and out  The food has very nice concepts but misses the mark on taste and flavor. Shared the banana bread pancakes and lobster roll. The banana bread pancakes had pretty good taste but the syrup was terrible in taste. The lobster roll was pretty good but for $16.00 was questionable whether was worth it. The housemaid chips that accompany the meal looked better then they tasted. Most of the dishes are fairly simple but the ones that we had just did not hit the mark.  Probably will not come back with all the restaurants in the area that are so good.

This place is pure magic!  I have ordered from here off of UberEATS probably 5 times now and I'm down to three things that I think are just phenomenal.   -Chicken and Waffles -Bruce Lee (juice) -Oatmeal  You must order these...now!
